page1.title: Sultan: The Saviour
page1.description: A man decides to save his sister from the clutches of a deadly Mafia Don. A remake of 2015 Tamil movie Vedalam.

page1.title: Meghnadbodh Rohoshyo
page1.description: When a famous writer disappears under mysterious circumstances, questions arise over who did it and why, while an old poem serves are the main clue to the mystery.

page1.title: Oskar
page1.description: Ratul is joined by the entire village as he sets out to make an Oscar-nominated film after dreaming about the award calling for his name.

page1.title: Hemanta
page1.description: Set amidst the backdrop of the entertainment world of Bengali cinema production, the film is about Hemanta Sen who goes off to the United States at a young age to study films. Modern-day adaptation of William Shakespeare's Hamlet.

page1.title: Michael
page1.description: Michael Khan Sen is a wannabe filmmaker, who sets out to make a film with yesteryear’s superstar Mayurbahan, his wife Shinjini, his landlord and his financer - heroine.

page1.title: Haami
page1.description: An innocent kiss on the cheek between two primary school students turns into a battle royal for the pair's concerned parents.

page2.title: Dharasnan
page2.description: In order to reach greater heights in her career, Tomosa is willing to go to any extent. Her over-ambitious nature lands her in a conflict with another woman, highlighting their different approaches towards life.

page2.title: Commrade
page2.description: The villagers of Singur and Nandigram resist the attempts by Left-backed goons to make them hand over land for two industrial ventures. Based on the Singur - Nandigram violence which took place in the period of 2006 to 2007 in West Bengal.

page2.title: Uma
page2.description: Based on a true incident, Uma is a story about a young girl who is fighting a terminal disease, a father who is struggling to make his daughter's dreams come true and about a director whose past haunts him.

page2.title: Baranda
page2.description: It is a melancholy story of a forlorn man who is crippled by an accident. Based on Moti Nandy’s eponymous novel, the film delves into the insecurity and dilemma of the man.

page2.title: Maacher Jhol
page2.description: First Bengali food film that revolves around a Paris-based chef who comes back to Kolkata after 13 years.

page2.title: Noor Jahaan
page2.description: The story of two young lovers, Noor (played by Adrit Roy) and Jahaan (played by Puja cherry).A remake of the 2016 Marathi film Sairat.

page3.title: Kabir : Peace Has A Price
page3.description: A young woman called Yasmin is held hostage by a seemingly decent Bengali guy Abir Chatterjee in the disguise of a terrorist. Will this encounter and their subsequent exchanges lead the Kolkata police to the Indian Mujahideen leaders?

page3.title: Boss 2: Back to Rule
page3.description: Surya, the man who taught his people the art of dreaming and making their dreams come true, has now turned into their biggest enemy. A sequel to 2013 thriller film, Boss: Born to Rule.

page3.title: Bibaho Diaries
page3.description: The story is about what a couple today looks like under a microscope before and after marriage - an account of all the hilarious things that bind them together and create complications amidst the amusing clashes of age-old tradition.

page3.title: Byomkesh Bakshi
page3.description: A Bengali detective, Byomkesh Bakshi, attempts solving mysteries with logic and his remarkable analytical skills with the help of his friend and assistant Ajit. Based on ‘Aadim Ripu’, it is the first installment of a Byomkesh film trilogy.

page3.title: Bilu Rakkhosh
page3.description: The story is a journey of a modern IT executive who has an inclination towards music. It’s a story of different psychological situations through a man’s mundane daily life and how he loses his soul. A critically acclaimed drama!!

page3.title: Total Dadagiri
page3.description: Joy is an engineering student, who failed repeatedly, falls in love at first sight with an MBA student Jonaki. Jonaki's father, the professor of the college who stands seriously against their love.A remake of the 2017 Telugu film Nenu Local.

page4.title: Raja Rani Raji
page4.description: A middle-class Bengali family’s youngest son Raja (Bonny Sengupta) is of no use. Flunking exams and naturally unemployed, he usually receives an earful from friends and relatives. Who and what urges him to change? Does he change?

page4.title: Bolo Dugga Maiki
page4.description: An adventure unfolds when Shayamo clicks a selfie with a sleeping girl on a train, which goes viral. A remake of 2015 Malayalam film Oru Vadakkan Selfie.

page4.title: Mukti
page4.description: The story of Mukti is based on the relationship between a teacher and her student and shows how they gradually grow affection towards each other.

page4.title: Chotoder Robi
page4.description: A Bengali Animated movie based on Rabindranath Tagore stories.

page4.title: Raasta
page4.description: Nil was in love with his classmate Somnath Banerjee's sister Liza. Liza betrayed him and she married someone else. Nil was upset and came back to Kolkata. A thriller movie!!

page4.title: Colkatay Columbus
page4.description: A satirical comedy with an element of fantasy that explores people’s desperate need to look to a hero for giving their life a direction, a purpose, to help them find themselves.

page5.title: Jio Pagla
page5.description: A group of four friends who are engaged in different professions shares a close bond. Ananta lives in a rented house, which is owned by Khogen Mal; in a dramatic turn of events, all the friends are forced to live together at Ananta's rented home.

page5.title: Yeti Obhijaan
page5.description: Kakababu and Sontu will unravel the mystery of the legendary beast, the Yeti (Snowman) in this film.A sequel to 2013 movie Mishawr Rawhoshyo.An adaptation of Pahar Churaye Aatonko from the Bengali adventure series Kakababu .

page5.title: Ghare Baire
page5.description: Based upon the novel Ghare Baire by Rabindranath Tagore, it deals with the emancipation of women and what it does to them and to the men who love them.

page5.title: Aroni Tokhon
page5.description: A Hindu man and a Muslim woman fall in love with each other and have to contend with the tensions that exist between their communities.

page5.title: Kanchenjunga Express
page5.description: Kanchenjunga Express is a 2012 Indian Bengali film directed by Arnab Ghosh.Kanchenjunga Express is a woman-centric film that unfolds in a train with a lot of suspense.

page5.title: Trishna
page5.description: An alluring housewife Tiasha (Rituparna Sengupta) seduced a professional photographer named Raja (Angshuman Gupta) in her trap to kill her husband Sekhar (Arindam Sil).A Bengali remake Hindi film Jism.

page6.title: Shyamali
page6.description: Shyamoli is a Drama bengali movie, directed by Annapurna Halder, starring Abhishek Chatterjee, Tarun Kumar, Nirmal Kumar, Subrata Chattopadhyay along with others.

page6.title: Shilpantar
page6.description: The film depicts the story of a village canvas painter(patua). He is bit different, instead of pleasing landscapes and images he always ends up drawing ghastly and disturbing images.

page6.title: Royal Bengal Rahashya
page6.description: Feluda and his gang get invited to North Bengal by a wealthy Zamindar to solve a piece of a puzzle, but things take a turn for the unexpected with a mysterious death and rumors about a man-eating tiger in the jungles.

page6.title: Robibar Bikelbela
page6.description: Rabibar Bikelbela strives to portray some ramifications of the violent Naxalite movement that struck West Bengal in the 1970s. The story is set in 1977, the aftermath of the Naksalbari movement in Bengal.

page6.title: Ranjana Ami Ar Ashbona
page6.description: Ranjana Ami Ar Ashbona is a 2011 Bengali language Indian rock musical drama film by Anjan Dutt. It won three national film awards in 2011 including best music direction and best feature film in Bengali.

page6.title: Ghuri
page6.description: Based on Khaled Hosseini's novel 'The Kite Runner' the story is about two childhood friends- one friend's search for his friend's son, taken captive by terrorists.

page7.title: Paanch Adhyay
page7.description: Paanch Adhyay is the story of love found and lost in the lives of a contemporary Indian couple, told in moments past and present. The film marks the Bengali language debut for Bollywood actress Dia Mirza.

page7.title: Ogo Bodhu Sundari
page7.description: Based on 1980 classic Bengali movie of the same name starring Uttam Kumar.

page7.title: Nisshabd
page7.description: Unable to tolerate the noise of the city, a man decides to escape to a village, where he meets the girl of his dreams. But his obsession with silence might interfere with his love.

page7.title: Mej Didi
page7.description: Mej Didi is a 2003 Bengali film directed by Shantimoy Bandyopadhyay and produced by Samrat Banerjee.Kesto lost his parents and comes to his step-sister's house.

page7.title: Kellafate
page7.description: A boy who grouses watching movies from projector room as his father is a projector man tries to get a girl's love using his theatre experience. It is a remake of 2007 Telugu film Aata starring Siddharth Narayan and Ileana D'Cruz.

page7.title: Katha
page7.description: A 2001 Bengali movie directed by Shankha Ghosh starring Kabir Suman, Gita Dey, and others.

page8.title: Hangover
page8.description: A man with a roving eye battles his midlife crisis.Hangover is a 2010 Bengali satirical comedy film directed by Prabhat Roy .

page8.title: Ghar Sansar
page8.description: Ghar Sansar is a 2010 Bengali Movie directed by Swapan Saha starring Arindam Ganguly, Anjana Bose, Sayantika Banerjee, Jishu Sengupta, Manjil Bandopadhyay and more.

page8.title: Ek Tukro Chand
page8.description: Simon Bubumba, the brother of President Bubumba of the small African state of Murundi, is kidnapped. Kakababu and Shontu search for the missing diplomat. They also find the thief who had stolen a stone collected from the moon's surface.

page8.title: Ekti Tarar Khonje
page8.description: It deals with a small-town boy, who comes to Calcutta to be a film actor, and gets involved in a modern-day Thugee cult.

page8.title: Akai Aaksho
page8.description: Akai Aaksho is a 2006 Bengali film directed by Babu Ray and produced by Bengal Film 2004. The film features actors Prosenjit Chatterjee and Rachana Banerjee in the lead roles.

page8.title: Byomkesh Pawrbo
page8.description: Byomkesh Bakshi travails the dark jungles of Dooars solving an enigma of a Ghostrider amidst a series of murders in north Bengal. A sequel to 2015 film Har Har Byomkesh!!

page9.title: Ballygunge Court
page9.description: The film centers around an apartment Ballygunge Court, and deals with the lives of three middle-aged couples and one elderly couple living there.

page9.title: Awara
page9.description: A young man must fight local goons for the love of a woman. It is a remake of the 2008 Telugu movie Krishna.

page9.title: Amanush
page9.description: Amanush is a 1975 Indian action drama film made in both Hindi and Bengali produced and directed by Shakti Samanta. The film stars Sharmila Tagore, Uttam Kumar, Utpal Dutt and Asit Sen. Both the versions were a hit.

page9.title: Aparajita Tumi
page9.description: This film explores the depths of what, on the surface, seems to be a picture-perfect family of Indians in America.The film is an adaptation of the novel 'Dui nari hate Tarbari' by famous Bengali writer Sunil Gangopadhyay.

page9.title: Anuranan
page9.description: The story of two couples, their struggle to survive as a unit, and as individuals.Anuranan is the first Bengali film to be shot in London.

page9.title: Amanush
page9.description: The story explores the mind of a youth who is mentally and physically abused in his childhood.A remake of the 2003 Tamil blockbuster superhit Kaadhal Kondein.

page11.title: Gangster
page11.description: Gangster Guru (Yash) decides to walk away from his criminal past after he falls for Ria (Mimi), but his ex-boss (Bratya) and a few others have a different plan for him. A romantic thriller!!

page11.title: Dhananjay
page11.description: The story is based on the conviction Dhananjoy, accused for the gruesome murder of Hetal Parekh, which took place in the year 1990.

page11.title: Thammar Boyfriend
page11.description: The story revolves around a wealthy but lonely woman Nandini played by Sabitri Chatterjee, who decides to tie the knot again and found a young and handsome bridegroom Partho played by Abir Chatterjee.

page11.title: Cosmic Sex
page11.description: One night, Kripa is on the run from sex and violence when he meets Sadhavi, a woman who strangely resembles his dead mother. She gives him shelter and teaches him to travel inwards through sex.

page11.title: Shirshendur Diary
page11.description: The movie, 'Shirshendur Diary', tells the story of a theatre director and filmmaker who goes missing one day. A controversial movie that takes a critical look at political violence in Bengal in the past decade.

page11.title: Ebong Bisarjan
page11.description: Gopal is a boy from a poor family who wants to do acting in theatre. Gopal respects Tista- producer of that group very much.Later he comes to know that everybody of this theatre group is corrupted.

page12.title: Byomkesh O Chiriyakhana
page12.description: Byomkesh O Chiriyakhana is 2016 Indian Thriller film on Bengali fictional detective Byomkesh Bakshi. The film is directed by Anjan Dutt. This is the fifth installment of Byomkesh series by Anjan Dutt, serving as a sequel to Byomkesh Bakshi 2015.

page12.title: Ami Je Ke Tomar
page12.description: A remake of 2015 Marathi film Mitwaa.Self-made hotelier and playboy Aditya Roy Chowdhury  falls for Esha and employs her in his resort, which he runs with his best friend, Prachi. Things go fine till Esha’s past meddles with their present.

page12.title: Telephone
page12.description: This is the story of a businessman, Parth, who is an agent of women trafficking in disguise and his wife, Ritu. Parth marries Ritu, so that he could sell her to women traffickers. But before he could do that, he finds out that Ritu is cheating on him.

page12.title: One
page12.description: Yash Dasgupta plays an honest police officer, whose sole aim in life is to destroy corruption in every form. In his lifelong battle against evil, he comes across his archenemy- an unscrupulous businessman - whose brutality knows no bounds.

page12.title: Durga Sohay
page12.description: A compassionate housewife who catches a young woman stealing in her house, gives her a second chance to redeem herself and live a respectable life. But, will the young thief start her life anew or will her past catchup with her?

page12.title: Praktan
page12.description: Praktan is a journey within a journey that simplifies the complexities of most modern day relationships.Newlyweds and estranged couples find wisdom while riding a train from Mumbai to Kolkata.

page13.title: Anubrata Bhalo Achho
page13.description: Anubrata (Ritwick) confronts his nemesis, death, every day, as his wife, Neeta (Debleena), fights a losing battle with cancer. His life changes when his path crosses that of Jaya (Swastika), whose husband is fighting a lung ailment in hospital.

page13.title: Antar Dahan
page13.description: Adapted from the story Banjha by Saikat Rakshit, the movie tells the story of a girl who is trapped into sexual harassments.

page13.title: Aaj Kaal Parsur Galpo
page13.description: A 1982 Bengali movie starring Mahua Roy Chowdhury, Dipankar Dey, Niranjan Ray, Ajitesh Bannerjee, Mala Banerjee, Alpana Gupta, Premangsu Bose. Movie is directed by Nabyendu Chatterjee.

page13.title: Game (2014)
page13.description: Abhimanyu finds out that a terrorist organization is planning attacks across the country. When he resists the execution of their plans, the group starts attacking his family and the battle gets personal. A remake of the 2012 Tamil film Thuppakki.

page13.title: Aloy Phera
page13.description: A story of a blind girl (Rituparna Sengupta) brought up in an orphanage who can sing well and turn out sculptures and statuettes with the magic touch of her hand.

page13.title: Baisakhi Megh
page13.description: This is a tragic story of the people who sacrificed their life for the struggle for independence.

page14.title: Bijoyini
page14.description: Set in urban Kolkata, Bijoyini is basically a love story which gets complicated with the presence of a third person. The film clearly shows how one destroys his own life out of greed and jealousy.

page14.title: Biye Notout
page14.description: A girl is always punctual, disciplined. Her husband loves her but the fact is he is not a disciplined and totally reverse with her wife.

page14.title: Chotushkone
page14.description: Four famous directors and old friends are reunited together by an unknown producer to make a film. They make four short stories in this film with one theme: Death.

page14.title: Dujone
page14.description: The parents of a wealthy man and a poor woman try to prevent their children from marrying. A remake of Yeh Dil 2003 Hindi romance film.

page14.title: Go For Goals
page14.description: The film tells the story of five guys, Diego, Jackson, Dudu, Kabir and Aman their passion for the game, crushes, and misses in their lives and sport.

page14.title: Hanuman.com
page14.description: Technology gets a small town teacher involved in an Iceland murder. Anjaniputra goes online and makes friends with Maria, a woman from Iceland. After he watches her being murdered on the webcam, he feels compelled to go and find the killer.

page15.title: Hothat Sedin
page15.description: The story is about Deepa ,a young graduate student who is in love with Sanjoy,a fellow student. He has already got a job and is more interested in his career and lacks punctuality and thoughtfulness though he is a nice guy.

page15.title: Kalankini Kankabati
page15.description: Kalankini Kankabati is a 1981 Bengali language Indian crime drama film directed by Uttam Kumar, starring Mithun Chakraborty, Sharmila Tagore, Supriya Choudhury, Asitbaran and Uttam Kumar.

professionals.name: R. D. Burman, Rahul Dev Burman

page15.title: Agni Sanskar
page15.description: A 1961 Romantic Classic Bengali Movie Directed by Agradoot starring Uttam Kumar, Supriya Debi, Anil Chatterjee.

page15.title: Lakshyaved
page15.description: The Bengali Film Lakshyaved Was Released In The Year 2009 Tapas Pal Swastika Mukherjee, Rachana Banerjee, Manoj Mitra, Sabyasachi Chakraborty, and Joy Mukherjee. Directed By Raj Mukherjee.

page15.title: Shapath
page15.description: Set against the backdrop of Vishakapattnam, Shapath - The Promise depicts the story of a dutiful police officer, Ranadeep Roy, a man dedicated to his country.

page15.title: Ganesh Talkies
page15.description: Ganesh Talkies is a 2013 Bengali film written and directed by Anjan Dutt. The movie is produced by Reliance Entertainment. It portrays two families of polar opposite Bengali and Marwari communities

page16.title: Trizama
page16.description: Trijama is a Drama bengali movie, directed by Agradoot, starring Uttam Kumar, Suchitra Sen, Chhabi Biswas, Jahar Gangopadhyay along with others.

page16.title: Aaghat
page16.description: Aaghat is a Thriller Bengali movie, directed by Anup Sengupta, starring Prosenjit, Rituparna Sengupta, June Maliya, Debraj Ray along with others.

page16.title: Jiban Jigyasa
page16.description: A 1971 Bengali Movie starring  Uttam Kumar, Supriya Choudhury, Sulata Chowdhury, Tarun Kumar, Gita Dey, Sailen Ganguly, Alka Ganguly. Directed by Piyush Bose.

page16.title: Mayer Raja
page16.description: Mayer Raja is a Drama bengali movie, directed by Milan Bhowmik, starring Jishu Sengupta, Ranjit Mallick, Tapas Pal, Rituparna Sengupta along with others.

page16.title: Antim Swash Sundar
page16.description: The film Last Breath Beautiful delves into these complex but realistic issues that confront the masses today.Can a philosopher's stone turn everything in life to gold? Can it become the elixir of life?

page16.title: Apanjan
page16.description: Set against the backdrop of the political violence that rocked India, and West Bengal in particular, in the late 1960s, it tells the story of an aged widow in a village who goes to Calcutta to stay with relatives, but faces only exploitation.

page17.title: Pitribhumi
page17.description: A 2007 Bengali Movie based on a novel by Prafulla Roy starring  Jeet, Swastika Mukherjee, Dipankar Dey .

page17.title: Paari
page17.description: This film was based on a story by the famous Bengali writer "Jarasandha".A hindi version "Anokha Milan" was later released in 1972.

page17.title: Phera
page17.description: Phera is a Bengali movie, directed by Buddhadeb Dasgupta, starring Aloknanda Dutta, Samit Bhanja, Biplab Chattopadhyay, Debika Mukhopadhyay along with others. It was entered into the 38th Berlin International Film Festival, competition section.

page17.title: Friend
page17.description: It is a complete science fiction with a social backdrop. Scientist Avirrup Mukherjee after his long experiment finally came in touch with an extra terrestrial life. A children's movie!!

page17.title: Charachar
page17.description: A young man (Rajit Kapoor) frees exotic birds from their cages, even though it's his job to capture them.

page17.title: Khancha
page17.description: The film deals with the personal crisis of two different women from two different backgrounds who battle it out and they lend each other's shoulder to cry on.

page18.title: Baidurya Rahasya
page18.description: An invaluable emerald was stolen from a Lord Krishna's temple on an island, that was insured for Rs. 8 lakhs. A crime thriller!!

page18.title: Ashani Sanket
page18.description: Famine and war threaten to tear apart a Bengal village during the '40s -- as well as the marriage of Gangacharan (Soumitra Chatterjee), who has assumed the role of religious leader and teacher, and his wife, Ananga (Babita).

page18.title: Shob Charitro Kalponik
page18.description: Radhika's husband dies, averting a possible divorce and allowing her to discover her own roots.

page18.title: Mon Amour Shesher Kobita
page18.description: Mon Amour: Shesher Kobita Revisited is an imaginary take-off of an ordinary love triangle with a touch of Shesher Kobita - a novel by Rabindranath Tagore, widely considered a landmark in Bengali literature

page18.title: The Festival
page18.description: The film focus on the various emotional currents passing among family and relatives underneath the supposedly festive occasion of Durga Puja.

page18.title: Uttar Meleni
page18.description: Uttar Meleni is a Drama bengali movie, directed by Uday Bhattacharya, starring Ranjit Mallick, Supriya Choudhury, Dipankar Dey, Samit Bhanja along with others.

page19.title: Tomake Chai
page19.description: A remake of award winning 2011 Kannada movie Sanju Weds Geetha. It's basically a story of two young hearts whose unconditional love for each other make them fight against all barriers.

page19.title: Open Tee Bioscope
page19.description: A rusticated boy in his adolescence comes to stay with his mother in North Kolkata and encounters some new experiences during his stay. The time-line of the story is in the 90's typical Northern part of Kolkata.

page19.title: Gora
page19.description: Gora is based on the novel written by Tagore in 1910. The backdrop of this film is the British period. Gora the protagonist, is a person who loves his motherland, is a staunch Hindu and to some extent superstitious. He adheres to the system of caste discrimination.

page19.title: Ganashatru
page19.description: An East Indian doctor (Soumitra Chatterjee) condemns the temple water in his brother's (Dhritiman Chatterjee) town.An adaptation of Henrik Ibsen's play An Enemy of the People.

page19.title: Le Halwa Le
page19.description: Love's wires are crossed in this hilarious caper; stratagems and misunderstandings abound as the young protagonists struggle to navigate their way through life, land jobs, and find a place to live.

page19.title: Paglu
page19.description: A remake of 2006 Telugu film Devadasu.Dev, a college student, meets Rimi– a girl who comes from the U.S., to study there. She becomes a matter of rivalry between Dev and his rival in college, Ronnie, whom Dev defeats in a challenge and wins over Rimi.

page20.title: Romeo
page20.description: A girl who is raised by her doting father travels to Kolkata to pursue her education and stays at her uncle's house.An official remake of the Telugu movie Konchem Ishtam Konchem Kashtam.

page20.title: Jekhane Bhooter Bhoy
page20.description: A storyteller provides the frame for three short narratives - three ghost stories for which an eager group of children serves as the audience.

page20.title: Jijibisha
page20.description: Priyanka, who is a call girl, yet a self-respectable woman and an eternal symbol of motherhood. She survives the journey of abuses, conflicts, and turbulence. Between all this, she struggles with her life to keep her head high fighting against the society.

page20.title: Clapstick
page20.description: 'Clapstick' is the story of the struggles, exploitation, and darkness that exists behind the glamor of the film industry.

page20.title: Zulfiqar
page20.description: An epic tale of brotherhood and hatred, friendship, and betrayal, Zulfiqar traces the meteoric rise and fall of the members of the Syndicate and their struggle for power.A modern day adaptation of two of William Shakespeare's tragedies.

page20.title: Amar Prithibi
page20.description: Amar Prithibi is a drama which is based on Disha and her relationships with members of her immediate family. Things start happening when an expensive necklace goes missing and this causes a severe misunderstanding between all of them.

page21.title: Bidyesh - The Envy
page21.description: “Bidyesh” is a story of two families and their belongings. Chowdhury and Roy families are famous as Jamindar of Valleys and Hills. The manager of Chowdhury family creates a distance between two families and as a result enmity arises bet'n them.
"1 1=3" is an Indian Drama Bengali Movie, which is Directed by Ashok Biswanathan and Actors by Ashok Biswanathan, Debdoot Ghosh, June Malia.

page21.title: Love Express
page21.description: Laal (Dev) belongs to a strict household where they believe in disowning a family member if he/she commits more than 100 mistakes. Laal is already guilty of committing 99 mistakes and he is on the verge of making his 100th mistake.

page21.title: Abby Sen
page21.description: Abby Sen a struggling TV producer time travels to 1980 to find a job in a leading TV channel.

page21.title: Teen Murti
page21.description: A story about three old retired men, Nabin, Nagen and Naren who are best friends.

page21.title: Pushpadhanu
page21.description: The movie Pushpadhanu is based on human relations and sentiments. It tells the story of Ishani,a leader of Geetali Sangha, a school of dance and drama and Shantanu, a flute artist.

page22.title: Pratisodh
page22.description: The story is about Ranjan who went to jail against a false allegation.Due to this his father became mad and roamed in the streets. His uncle Sanatan made a conspiracy and as a result, all these accidents happened.

page22.title: Haat Baralei Bandhu
page22.description: A 1960 Bengali Movie starring Uttam Kumar , Sabitri Chattopadhyay, Chhabi Biswas, Pahari Sanyal, Tarun Kumar Directed by Sukumar Dasgupta.

page22.title: Dui Purush
page22.description: Nutubihari Mukherjee was a freedom fighter and a man of strict principles. At a time when the problem of land ownership and deprivation of peasants ran amok, he took up the courage to study the law with the sole purpose of bringing reforms in the peasant rules

page22.title: Dooratwa
page22.description: Mandar is a Political Science teacher who often finds himself in some sort of dilemma. The whole film revolves around the dilemmas faced by Mandar to choose the right path.

page22.title: Devdas
page22.description: Debdash is a cinematic adaptation of the famous novel of the same name by  Saratchandra Chatterjee

page22.title: Dekha
page22.description: Dekha is a chronicle of a blind poet who has seen the world, and got a glimpse of love and passion by his 'vision'; after becoming 'blind' he collects images from his memory and meets a born blind youth who sings mystic verses.

page23.title: Ami Aadu
page23.description: An endearing love story in the time of cultural conflicts presenting the personal tragedy of the emigrant commoner caught in the crossfire of international wars.

page23.title: Pakaram
page23.description: Tapu , young boy of 10-11 years is born with a knack for seeing, believing and perceiving things unlike many and has the potential to depict them through his creativity. When lost in his own world, he is often oblivious to what the present demands from him.

page23.title: Sondhey Namaar Aagey
page23.description: Sondhey Namaar Aagey is a thriller based on the life of a young girl who is out to find out the truth about her mother's death.

page23.title: Eagoler Chokh
page23.description: A detective seeks the truth about the murder of a young woman.It is the sequel to 2015 film Ebar Shabor and the second installment of Goenda Shabor film series.

page23.title: Antarleen
page23.description: Kolkata police detective Aniket Sanyal (Kharaj) goes on a holiday to Kasauli in Himachal Pradesh after his wife’s death, only to be sought out to solve the mystery behind the well-planned murder of another tourist.

page23.title: Khawto
page23.description: A young couple meet a mysterious man who, in the course of conversation, covers Japanese cuisine, Bengali literature, and his own checkered past.

page24.title: Ichchhemotir Gappo
page24.description: The story revolves around the budding relationship between its two central characters, Ichche and Neel, despite their contrasting personalities.

page24.title: Asha Jaoar Majhe
page24.description: Set in the crumbling environs of Calcutta, Asha Jaoar Majhe -Labour of Love, is a lyrical unfolding of two ordinary lives suspended in the duress of a spiraling recession.

page24.title: Chorabali
page24.description: A whodunit thriller set in the backdrop of North Kolkata with its British Raj charm, that is loosely based on Agatha Christie's Cards on the Table.

page24.title: Ebar Shabor
page24.description: Detective Shabor sets out to solve the murder case of Mitali Ghosh , a woman with a messy past. Her ex-husband Mithu Mitra, ex-flame Pantu Haldar and friend Samiran are the prime suspects and so is her cousin Joyeeta.

page24.title: Kelor Kirti
page24.description: Three young couples navigate their relationships in this comic take on modern love.

page24.title: Banobhumi
page24.description: Bonobhumi is a 2007 Indian Bengali film released on Jan 01, 2007. The film is directed by Swapan Ghosal.

page25.title: Songshoy
page25.description: The film depicts how it is torn between its old left ideology and the new-found fascination of their party for globalisation and privatisation.

page25.title: Nagarik
page25.description: Nagarik, also spelled as Nagorik, The Citizen in English, was the first feature-length film directed by Indian director Ritwik Ghatak.

page25.title: Bibhas
page25.description:
A 1964 Bengali movie starring Uttam Kumar, Lalita Chatterjee, Anubha Gupta.
Director-Binu Bardhan

page25.title: Golapi Mukta Rahasya
page25.description: A rosy colored pearl owner gets threatened by some outcomers, so he meets Feluda for its solution. A TV movie based on The Mystery of the Pink Pearl -a Bengali detective story written by Satyajit Ray.

page25.title: Chopper
page25.description: A 1987 Bengali movie starring Joy Banerjee, Sreela Majumdar, Mrinal Basu, Snatana Basu, Shobha Sen and himself, Nabyendu Chatterjee presents a thought-evoking portrayal of the lives of the members of a poor family in Kolkata.

page25.title: Challenge
page25.description: Puja is the daughter of a very conservative father, who will not let anyone near her. But Puja is hoping to find a man who can challenge her father. A remake of the 2005 Telugu film Bunny.

page26.title: Bhagini Nivedita
page26.description: Bhagini Nivedita is a 1962 Bengali film directed by Bijoy Basu. The story was based on the life of Sister Nivedita. It won a national film award in best films category and a presidential medal.

page26.title: Baghini
page26.description: aghini is a 1968 Bengali film directed by Bijay Bose. Soumitra Chatterjee stars as the main hero, Chiranjib, and Sandhya Roy plays the film's heroine, Dugga. Jahar Ganguly plays Dugga's father, a liquor merchant; Rabi Ghosh plays Bhola, a villain.

page26.title: Adhikar (1939)
page26.description: Adhikar is a social drama film directed by Pramathesh Barua, made in 1939 in Hindi and Bengali languages, and produced by New Theatres.Melodrama about lineage and property questions.

page26.title: Swapno Niye
page26.description: A 1966 Bengali Movie starring Madhabi Mukherjee, Robi Ghosh, Arun Mukhopadhyay. Directed by Purnendu Patree.

page26.title: Parashuram
page26.description: A rural migrant comes to the city and shares a temporary shelter with an old beggar in an abandoned graveyard.

page26.title: Mohnar Dikey
page26.description: A 1984 Bengali Movie starring Anil Chatterjee, Anup Kumar, Aparna Sen, Arun Mukherjee, Dilip Roy, Dipankar Dey, Lily Chakravarty, Manoj Mitra, Robi Ghosh, Sumitra Mukherjee, Ramaprasad Banik.

page27.title: Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne
page27.description: Goopy wants to sing, and Bagha wants to play the dhol. They meet accidentally and are helped by King of Ghosts.

page27.title: Elar Char Adhyay
page27.description: A group of young revolutionaries, led by Indranath, fight for independence. Ela, the group's emancipated teacher, is caught in a dilemma between her love for Atindra and her commitment towards working for the country.

page27.title: Ek Din Raatre
page27.description: A naive peasant enters an apartment block to find a drink, and the residents mistake him for a thief. As he evades capture, he exposes the venality and dishonesty of the building's residents.Bengali Version of Jagte Raho Hindi Movie.

page27.title: Banhisikha
page27.description: A 1976 Bengali romantic movie starring Uttam Kumar, Supriya Choudhury, Ranjit Mullik, Tarun Kumar, Olivia, Asim Kumar, Sambhu Bhattachayra, Shibani Bose, Kalyani Adhikari, Robin Banerjee.

page27.title: The Bhoot Of Rose Ville
page27.description: Rose is in love with Sameer. But her father is against the marriage. An emotional blackmail later, Rose is resigned to marry her childhood orphan friend, Robin. But three days before their marriage, Robin meets with an accident that leaves him severely injured.

page27.title: Seemabaddha
page27.description: Seemabaddha is a 1971 social drama Bengali film directed by Satyajit Ray. It is based on the novel Seemabaddha by Mani Shankar Mukherjee. It stars Barun Chanda, Harindranath Chattopadhyay, and Sharmila Tagore in lead roles.

page28.title: Kapurush O Mahapurush
page28.description: This movie demarcates the deficiencies of the male personality & its after effects on the female counterpart.

page28.title: Chokh
page28.description: The film is set in during the Emergency period in December 1975. Jadunath a labour union leader, has been given death sentence, for the murders of mill owner Jethia’s brother, and another worker, even though he never committed them.

page28.title: Teen Tanaya
page28.description: Director Sukla Mitra portrays three Tagore poems Koni, Camellia and Phanki. The poems are all named after the three female protagonists and the film has been made centered around them.

page28.title: Sahar Thekey Durey
page28.description: Bengali movie directed by Sailajanand Mukherji, starring Jahor Ganguly, Dhiraj Bhattacharya, Naresh Mitra.

page28.title: Miss Priyambada
page28.description: When the uncle is villain in their love, a man places his friend disguised as nurse in his Girlfriend's home. There the uncle falls in love with the nurse and the nurse falls in love with heroine's friend.

page28.title: Manik Jore
page28.description: A 1952 Bengali movie starring Nabadwip Haldar, Shyam Laha, Tarun Majumdar, Biren Mitra, Shyamali Chakraborty, Rajlakhsmi, Sabita Chatterjee, Jharna Chakraborty and directed by  Kalipada Das.

page30.title: Megh Kalo
page30.description: Sagar Mukherjee is a tea taster in profession. He lives beside the house of Shipra, his neighbour, Prasad Halder is the boss of Sagar’s company and he also lives beside them.

page30.title: Bidehir Khonje Rabindranath
page30.description: A group of young boys and girls join Researcher and Documentary maker Abhijit Sen to Santiniketan just for the sake of fun. They are a generation to whom Rabindranath Tagore is a subject of History and they have vague ideas about this Nobel Laureate.

page30.title: Arogya Niketan
page30.description: A 1969 Bengali Movie starring Bikash Roy, Sandhya Roy, Robi Ghosh, Jahar Ganguli, Chhaya Devi, Dilip Roy, Bankim Ghosh, Ruma Guha Thakurta, Kali Sarkar, Subhendu Chatterjee, Sudhir Aich and directed by Bijoy Bose.

page30.title: Rajdrohi
page30.description: Rajdrohi is a protest against the social structure of corruption. A simple village person Pratap accidentally became a revolutionary. Many years ago Pratap lived in a village. He was happy with his mother and his girl friend Chinta.

page30.title: Rater Rajani Gandha (1973)
page30.description: A 1973 Bengali movie starring Uttam Kumar, Aparna Sen, Pahadi Sanyal, Tarun Kumar, Jayasree Sen, Bankim Ghosh.

page30.title: Rangin Godhuli
page30.description: Rangeen Godhuli was released on 2009 Bengali film starring Sabysachi Chakraborty, Bratati Banerjee, Bodhistya Majumdar, Suman Halder

page31.title: Rakta Tilak
page31.description: A 1974 Action drama Bengali movie starring Uttam Kumar, Biswajeet, Supriya Choudhury, Robi Ghosh, Nripati Chatterjee, Alka Ganguly, Tarun Kumar, Bankim Ghosh, Prasenjit Chatterjee.

page31.title: Rajat Jayanti
page31.description: The simple-minded Rajat (Barua) loves neighbor Jayanti (Menaka Devi). He is advised on how to court her by his street-smart cousin Bishwanath (Sanyal) and Bishwanath's friend Samir (Bannerjee).

page31.title: Proxy
page31.description: Proxy is a romantic comedy of a pair of twin sisters and twin brothers who, unaware of each other's sibling gets caught in a web of confusion and end up confusing everybody around.

page31.title: Karunamoyee
page31.description: An old father suddenly dies leaving behind a young daughter. The landlord's son offers to marry her and all seems to start off well. But his mother starts posing problems for her.

page31.title: Ei Korechho Bhalo
page31.description: A 1970 Bengali Film  starring Anup Kumar, Jui bandyopadhyay, Lily chakraborty, Rabi Ghosh, Bhanu Roy, and Kanu Bandyopadhyay. The Bengali film is directed by Ajit Bandyopadhyay. Adhir Bagchi scored the music in this Film.

page31.title: Dui Bhai
page31.description: The film starts by showing the love and affection of two brothers, Kamal and Utpal. Their uncle was a crook and he cleverly drove away Kamal and Utpal out of the village by taking possession of their house.

page32.title: Sagar Sangamey
page32.description: Sagar Sangamey (The Holy Island) is a 1959 Bengali film directed by Debaki Bose. The film won the National Award for the Best Film and the Best Child Actress in 1959.

page32.title: Magno Mainak
page32.description: Magno Mainak is the famous story of Nengti, Hena and Santoshbabu, and peculiar circumstances of the deaths of Hena and Santoshbabu. Based on popular Bengali fictional private investigator Bomkesh Bakshi.

page32.title: Kahini
page32.description: The Bengali Film Kahini Was released In the Year 1995 Starring Dhritiman Chatterjee, Debesh Roy Chowdhury, Debashish Goswami, Nilkantha Sengupta, Utpal Bhattacharya, and Soma Chakraborty, Kaberi Bose.

page32.title: Kabita
page32.description: Kabita is a 1977 Bengali-language Indian feature film directed by Bharat Shamsher starring Mala Sinha in the lead role. The film is a remake of the Tamil classic film Aval Oru Thodar Kathai where Kamal Hassan had a supporting role as a neighbor.

page32.title: Jiban Maran
page32.description: A famous radio singer Mohan (Saigal) is in love with Geeta (Leela Desai). When he goes to his friend a doctor, TB Specialist, Bijoy (Bhanu) for a check-up, he is found to be in an advance stage of TuberColosis TB.

page32.title: Jhor
page32.description: The Bengali Film Jhor was released in the year 1979, Directed by Utpal Dutt, starring: Sumitra Mukhopadhyay, Rabi Ghosh, Utpal Dutt, Satya Bandopadhyay.

page33.title: Bou Thakuranir Hath
page33.description: Based on true story of Raja Pratapaditya Roy of Jessore. Starring Rama Devi, Manju Dey, Uttam Kumar, Naresh Mitra, Nitish Mukherjee, Padmadevi and Pahadi Sanyal.

page33.title: Bedroom
page33.description: The film is about Joy, Deb, and Ananda. While Joy is a struggling actor and conducts workshops, Ananda works in an I.T. company and Deb is an actor. However barring Deb, the rest of the couples don't share any intimacy at all.

page33.title: Raat Bhor
page33.description: Ratbhor is a Suspense bengali movie, directed by Raj Mukherjee, starring Indrani Haldar, Rupa Ganguly, Debika Mukhopadhyay, Arindol Bagchi along with others.

page33.title: Madly Bangali
page33.description: Members of a Bangla rock band, 'Madly Bangali', tell the story of their life revolved around music.Directed by Anjan Dutt, the movie is about Soumyak, Anubrato, Tanaji and Sumeet who are trying to make it big with their Bangla band.

page33.title: Kanch Kata Hirey
page33.description: The story starts when Subrata Gupta comes back from America after finishing his higher studies to india after seven years. Subrata has not changed though he was in America for seven years.

page33.title: Kokhono Megh
page33.description: After her diamond-smuggling uncle is murdered, a woman is terrorized by the fortune-seeking former associates the uncle once double-crossed. She meets a charming stranger, but can he be trusted?

page34.title: Chaitali
page34.description: A woman who has had a difficult life is treated with kindness by a middle class family. She is wrongfully accused of a theft she did not commit, when her sordid past comes to light.

page34.title: Bedeni
page34.description: The movie is about a woman's desire and decision to act on her own will and make the necessary choices to fulfill her deepest sexual urges. Radhika, the protagonist, is a serial cuckoldress. She has no qualms about migrating from one man to another.

page34.title: Bachchan (2014)
page34.description: It is the official remake of the 2011 Kannada film Vishnuvardhana.In this film, the hero is the son of a poor man, who does not want end up like his father. He dreams of earning a lot of money. His luck changes when he accidentally gets the mobile phone of a don.

page34.title: Srodhanjali
page34.description: Amit belongs to a middle class family and lives with his father, elder brother Sumit and Sumit’s wife. He is an educated person but has no job. Swati, Amit’s lover for 8 years also belongs to a middle class family and stays with her mother.

page34.title: Sesh Ashray
page34.description: Shesh Ashray is a 2001 film directed by Ajit Ganguly and produced by Tushar Kanti Jana.The film has bean music composed by Anupam Dutta.

page34.title: Samudra Sakshi
page34.description: "This film is based on a woman's life - a simple house wife called Manoshi (Amala Shankar) lived with her husband Jatin (Santi Mukharjee) and a son Jaymalya (Jishu). She spends her entire life for her family but her son Joy did not realise that.

page35.title: Madhuganjer Sumati
page35.description: The Bengali Film Madhuganjer Sumati was released in the year 1988, Directed by Tutul Banerjee, starring Deba, Piu, Rina Chowdhury.

page35.title: Ek Din Pratidin
page35.description: Ek Din Pratidin is a 1979 Bengali film directed by Mrinal Sen. The film stars Mamata Shankar, Gita Sen and Sreela Majumdar, among others. It was entered into the 1980 Cannes Film Festival.

page35.title: Rakhe Hari Mare Ke
page35.description: Rakhe Hari Mare Ke is a 2003 Bengali film directed by Ratan Adhikari and produced by Pritam Jalan. The film features actors Prosenjit Chatterjee, Rachana Banerjee, Raima Sen in the lead roles.

page35.title: Pratikar
page35.description: The Bengali Film Pratikar was released in the year 1987 starring Victor Banerjee, Chiranjit, Madhabi Mukherjee.

page35.title: Maati O Manush
page35.description: Mati O Manush is a film about the deeply ingrained beliefs in people living in backwaters of rural Bengal even today. Witch hunting is still not unheard of in such areas in West Bengal.

page35.title: Komal Gandhar
page35.description: Komal Gandhar, also known as A Soft Note on a Sharp Scale, is a 1961 Bengali film written and directed by noted film maker Ritwik Ghatak. A highly critical look at the role of "progressive" art and artists in a changing society.

page36.title: Handa And Bhonda
page36.description: Handa is a simple, sincere and hardworking person, but his honesty even lands him in trouble sometimes, created by his not-so-perfect colleagues and his own boss. Handa's son, Bhonda, is exactly opposite to his father's character isn't.He is a brat.

page36.title: Katakuti
page36.description: Dr. Sudesna Roy Chowdhury – a psychiatrist of an asylum, perceives a resemblance between her deceased son and Piklu, a mentally challenged patient. He tried to shed the blood of his esurient and self-absorbed finance and then succumbed to mental imbalance.

page36.title: Rang Milanti
page36.description: The film is a light-hearted comedy about a girl's indecision when she has to choose her life partner from four of her friends — Rik (Gaurav), Tito (Indrasish), DJ (Gourab) and Laden (Tanaji).

page36.title: Gosainbaganer Bhoot
page36.description: The film narrates the tale of Burun, who is hopelessly weak in mathematics and has to take lessons from an eccentric teacher. However, not all is well in Burun's world and he strays into Gosainbagan, befriends an enduring ghost only to later battle an evil force.

page36.title: Faande Poriya Boga Kaande Re
page36.description: A remake of the 2010 Telugu film Maryada Ramanna.Raju, a simple guy with whom Mishti falls in love with, tries to survive from Mishti’s father and her brothers who are all out for revenge, because Raju's father killed Mishti’s uncle.

page36.title: Arshinagar
page36.description: Arshinagar is an imaginary neighborhood, which is terrorized by two rival gangs belonging to the Khans & the Mitras. Both families are in the real estate business and are sworn, enemies. The screenplay is an adaptation of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet.

page37.title: Mon Je Kore Uru Uru
page37.description: Diya comes to visit her dad in India. The members of Mone Je Kore Uru Uru club, decide to kidnap Diya but end up abducting some other girl of that name.

page37.title: Atithi (Bengali)
page37.description: This is the story of a strange wanderlust in a teen-aged boy, Tarapada who often ran away from his home for days to join groups of wandering players, musicians and acrobats.

page37.title: Alik Sukh
page37.description: The film is based on a Suchitra Bhattacharya novel. It deals with the dilemma faced by doctors of choosing between ethics and material pleasure. A successful gynecologist and happily married man have to confront his internal conflict at a crucial time.

page37.title: Aamar Bhuvan
page37.description: Aamar Bhuvan is a 2002 Bengali film directed by Mrinal Sen. The film depicts a place of India where people live peacefully and love each other despite the hatred and violence that scars the rest of the nation.

page37.title: Aainaate
page37.description: Aainate is a journey into the several nook and corners of social bindings and the compulsions of womanhood confined within it.

page37.title: Sheyal Debota Rahasya
page37.description: A TV movie based on Feluda detective stories.

page38.title: Surya Sakkhi
page38.description: A 1981 Bengali movie starring Uttam Kumar, Mohua Roy Chowdhury, Mrinal Mukherjee, Chhaya Debi, Geeta Dey, Santana Basu, Kumari Shakuntala, Kamal Mitra, Asit Baran, Montu Banerjee, Biplam Chatterjee, Dilip Basu.

page38.title: Joi Baba Felunath
page38.description: The theft of a priceless statue of an elephant god pulls a detective away from vacation to investigate various characters.

page38.title: Jackpot (Bengali)
page38.description: Finalists on a reality-TV show must complete the duties of a police constable or a driver in order to win a fortune

page38.title: Adwitiya
page38.description: Rajib is an upper middle class cultured person. He is very close to his mother. His mother and his best friend were worried about his family life. So they took a decision. Rajib's mother had selected a beautiful bride for him while he was away.

page38.title: Abak Prithibi
page38.description: A 1959 Bengali movie starring Uttam Kumar, Sabitri Chattopadhyay, Tarun Kumar, Aparna Debi, Tulsi Chakraborty, Gangapada Basu and Shyam Laha. Directed by Bishu Chakraborty. Music by Amal Mukhopadhyay.(1985 Re-certified print)

page38.title: A Tale Of A Naughty Girl
page38.description: Based on a short story by Bengali writer Prafulla Roy, the central idea developed by director Dasgupta, tells the story of a girl, Lati, whose mother Rajani is a prostitute living and working in a brothel in rural India.[ Mondo Meyer Upakhyan -Original Title. ]

page39.title: Paresh
page39.description: Paresh (nirmal kumar)is a boy brought up by his uncle (pahari sanyal) who expect his nephew Paresh would be like him as he followed the path of truth.

page39.title: Mahasweta
page39.description: The widower land-lord fixes his wayward step-brother's alliance with priest's daughter. Groom disappears on wedding day, and he is forced to marry her. The brother comes back and when the elder brother dies, tries to dispossess the widow.

page39.title: Doshta Dosh
page39.description: Durgaprasad's telephone service is suspended because of delinquency on bills, and he dispatches his strongman Montu Singh to pay off the huge bill. In a twist of fate, human error causes the money to be allocated to the account of another person.

page39.title: Dhanraj Tamang
page39.description: Dhanraj Tamang, the local supervisor of the Simtong tea estate is an honest and loveable man. His motto of life is to help the needy. He saves women from sexual abuse but ironically his own wife is raped by his tea-estate’s saheb.

page39.title: Atattar Din Pare
page39.description: A 1971 Bengali movie starring Samit Bhanja, Jaya Bhaduri, Anup Kumar, Kali Bannerjee, Chinmoy Roy, Biren Chatterjee.

page39.title: Saheb Bibi Golaam
page39.description: Three very different people from three very different worlds collide one winter afternoon in an anarchic Kolkata.

page40.title: Jato Kando Kathmandu Te
page40.description: A TV movie based on Feluda detective story.

page40.title: Gulmohar (Bengali)
page40.description: Gulmohar is a bengali movie, directed by Kartik Chattopadhyay, starring Biswajeet, Asit Baran, Bhanu Bandyopadhyay, Basanta Chowdhury along with others.

page40.title: Sita
page40.description: This mythological story revolves around Sita - the most famous female character of the Hindu epic - Ramayana. Janak, the king of Mithila finds a girl on his own farm and brings her home.

page40.title: Sesh Sanghat
page40.description: Sesh Sanghat's storyline, revolving around the poor and the downtrodden, with a Naxal twist makes the movie a good watch!

page40.title: Kashti Pathar
page40.description: One very poor lady Rama (chandhya ray). The saving money of her father is finised someday they have not any food for eat. The creditors insult them so she need a service immediately.

page40.title: Goraay Gondogol
page40.description: A bunch of shady characters tries to help a young man win his lady love. Rik and Pola are in love, but Pola’s father will only let her marry someone from an established joint family.

page41.title: Bon Palashir Padabali
page41.description: This is a tragic tale about a handful of characters of the village of Bonpolashi. We have Girija (Bikash Roy), his wife & their daugheter Bimala along with his brother Girindra (Nirmal Kumar) & his wife (Madhabi Mukherjee) & their daughter Pramila.

page41.title: Bishh
page41.description: The film is a one-night tale of three college friends. Ditched by men, the trio seems to have had enough of men's use-and-throw tactics. It's now their turn to be equally spiteful and do to men what they've done to them.

page41.title: Antariksha
page41.description: Antariksha is a bengali movie, directed by Rajen Tarafdar, starring Chhabi Biswas, Sandhya Roy, Dilip Ray, Harimohan Bose along with others.

page41.title: Amrita Kumbher Sandhane
page41.description: Amrita Kumbher Sandhane is a 1982 Bengali film directed by Dilip Roy. It is based on a story by "Kalkut", pseudonym of Samaresh Basu.

page41.title: Aarohan
page41.description: "Aarohan" is the tale of a 75-year-old Soumitra Chatterjee, who firmly believes in the predictions made in his horoscope so much so that he insists on checking in at Mukti Bhawan to die.

page41.title: Tiger
page41.description: Tiger is a 2007 Bengali film directed by Swapan Saha. The film featured Mithun Chakraborty and Debashree Roy. It is the remake of Tamil film Ramanaa stars Vijakanth in lead role.The film deals with how a teacher along with his students fight corruption.

page42.title: Sesh Uttar
page42.description: The wealthy, self-obsessed, and possibly crazed Manoj is sent by his concerned family to the rural estate of his future father-in-law. Along the way, however, he gets lost and soon finds himself taking shelter in the abode of railroad stationmaster.

page42.title: Nagpash
page42.description: The locale of the story is a river terrain, deep in Sunderban's dense forests; criss-crossing rivers and pouncing predators. It is the day of Dusserah, the last day of Durgapujal.

page42.title: Mahabiplabi Arabindo
page42.description: Arabinda Ghosh the brilliant boy of Bengal after completion of his education from abroad joined Baroda estate. He was well-connected with Bengal from Baroda. Arabinda wrote some great article on independence from there.

page42.title: Kharij
page42.description: It tells the story of a middle-class family whose child servant is found dead, and their efforts to pacify his grieving father.

page42.title: Galpa Holeo Satyi
page42.description: A family where relation in between family members have been deteriorated to the worst level even affecting their professional life, an outsider tries to rebuild the love and compassion within the family.

page42.title: Target (2010 Film)
page42.description: Target: The Final Mission is the story Suvankar, an upright police officer whose daredevilry is obstructed by a Sadhu, a criminal in disguise, but Anthony, a man with a mission arrives to protect Suvankar.

page43.title: Hotath Neerar Jonnyo
page43.description: Rani is a housewife with a successful husband, Tapas, and a kid. One day her old friend from college Abinash comes into her life.He asks her to spend a day with him so that he can get over her.

page43.title: Ek Tukro Agoon
page43.description: A 1963 Bengali Movie starring Biswajeet, Pahari Sanyal. Directed by Binu Bardhan.

page43.title: Deewana 2013
page43.description: A remake of the 2007 Tamil film Deepavali. Deewana is a love story about Abhi a fun loving boy and Shruti, the daughter of Agnidev Roy, a dreaded goon from Kolkata.

page43.title: Clerk
page43.description: Clerk explores the complex psychology of an average middle-class Bengali man.But once he returns to his lonely flat, a different person emerges- a romantic, a loverboy living in the world of celluloid fantasies.First surreal film in Bengali!!

page43.title: Boss: Born To Rule
page43.description: A remake of the 2012 Telugu film Businessman. Surya wants to become a Mafia don until he falls in love with the police commissioner's daughter.

page43.title: Man Sanman
page43.description: The Bengali Film Man Sanman Was released In the Year 1993 Starring Ranjit Mullick, Chiranjit, Satabdi Roy, Anuradha Roy, Subhendu Chatterjee, Nimu Bhowmik, and Lily Chakraborty.

page44.title: Jamai No.1
page44.description: Wealthy industrialist Biren Mishra has two wives and three sons-in-law. The two elder ones are idle and live off the father-in-law. When the third one, a petty thief, enters the family, everything is set to change.

page44.title: Dus Din Pore
page44.description: This is a story about Deba, an antisocial and Minu, who lived alone after murdering her drunken husband. Minu has developed a relation with Khayra, also an antisocial and opponent of Deba.

page44.title: Devi
page44.description: In rural 19th-century India, the Doyamoyee marries Umaprasad and moves in with his family. Doyamoyee cares for her husband's elderly father, Kalikinkar, who dreams that the girl is a goddess.

page44.title: Deepar Prem
page44.description: A 1983 Bengali movie starring Tapas Pal, Moon Moon Sen, Chhaya Devi, Arundhati Devi, Bhupen Hazarika and Debika Mukherjee.

page44.title: Dagi
page44.description: During the Hindu-Muslim riots, Kamla’s family got scattered. Her two sons Krishna and Gopal became Sunderlal and Arup respectively. Sunderlal fought for the rights of the poor against their exploitation by the men of rich guy.

page44.title: Ashchorjyo Prodeep
page44.description: The film deals with the unfulfilled aspirations of an everyday couple whose dreams never become reality and as they try hard to excel in life. Anilabha discovers a magic lamp from which a genie emerges and is able to take him to unseen heights in life.

page45.title: Arjun Aamar Naam
page45.description: Arjun is a man, who helps his villagers at every step of life. After losing his father as a child, Arjun lives with his mother and maternal uncle’s family. He has to face a lot of opposition from the rich and influential people in his village.

page45.title: Agradani
page45.description: This is based on a short story by Tara Sankar Bandyopadhhay. Agradani is the name of a particular class of Brahmins who were thought to be God’s chosen ones to perform the eating ceremony.

page45.title: Tumi Robe Nirobe
page45.description: Tumi Robe Nirobe is a Romance Bengali movie released in 2008.

page45.title: Shunyo Awnko
page45.description: A citified executive meets an idealistic journalist who challenges his values as he negotiates with tribal peoples to acquire their land for mining.

page45.title: Pathik
page45.description: A 1953 Bengali Movie starring Sombhu Mitra, Tripti Mitra, Monika Ganguly, Kali Bannerjee, Manoranjan Bhattacharya, Gangapada Basu, Tulsi Lahiri.

page45.title: Jahangirer Swarna Mudra
page45.description: Jahangirer Swarnamudra (The Gold Coins of Jahangir) is based on a Bengali detective story written by Satyajit Ray starring his famous character Feluda. A TV movie directed by Sandip Ray.

page47.title: Aalo Chhaya
page47.description: Aranyo and his friends set out an adventurous weekend and reach an all mansion.There they meet an old man who starts to all them the history of the place, the story of ‘aalo chhaya’.

page47.title: Street Light
page47.description: Amitava marries a beautiful woman called Mitali. Mitali is an ambitious lady and wants to become an actress. She leaves him and walks out and her vacuum is filled by Hiya, a call girl.

page47.title: Natobar Not Out
page47.description: The film is about a budding poet who believes he has poetry in his blood. But instead of meandering into a struggle tale of a bumpkin wanting to make it big, Sen integrates a quirky twist by introducing Tagore as an animated character.

page47.title: Jaani Dyakha Hawbe
page47.description: A young musician and a model have the same dream together, and they meet and fall in love at a bookstore. When their relationship starts to fall apart, an out-of- work magician steps in.

page47.title: Challenge 2
page47.description: A righteous cop accepts the challenge of taking on a mob boss, little dreaming that his own father is one of the don's victims.

page47.title: Prem Amar
page47.description: Robi leads a lazy life until he meets Ria, a new resident in his colony. When they fall in love, they are forced to remain apart after Ria is betrothed to the man who supports her family.A remake of Tamil film 7G Rainbow Colony.

page48.title: Paran Jai Jaliya Re
page48.description: A remake of 2007 Hindi film Namastey London.Rather than agree to an arranged marriage, a woman brings her fiancee to England to break up with him, Western style.

page48.title: Bose Pukure Khoon Kharapi
page48.description: Bosepukure Khunkharapi is a TV movie of Feluda Series. This film is based on "Acharya Murder Case". Fedula and his assistant Topse solve the case.

page48.title: Goopy Bagha Phire Elo
page48.description: Goopy Bagha Phirey Elo is the sequel to 1980 film Hirak Rajar Deshe and the third installment of Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne series. It was directed by Sandip Ray and written by his father Satyajit Ray.

page48.title: Dakhal
page48.description: Dakhal is a 1981 Indian Bengali film directed by Gautam Ghose, with Mamata Shankar, Robin Sen Gupta, Sunil Mukherjee and Sujal Roy Chowdhury in lead roles.

page48.title: Chorus
page48.description: Chorus was a 1974 Bengali film directed by noted Indian art film director Mrinal Sen. It was entered into the 9th Moscow International Film Festival where it won a Silver Prize.

page48.title: Chhandaneer
page48.description: A classical dance film focusing on the performance skills of Anjana Bannerjee who plays the central character, Seema, an internationally acclaimed Bharat Natyam dancer with a comfortable middle-class background.

page49.title: Chalachal
page49.description: Chalachal is a Drama, Romance bengali movie, directed by Asit Sen, starring Arundhati Debi, Anil Chatterjee, Asit Baran, Jahar Roy along with others.

page49.title: Aro Ekjon
page49.description: A story involving a rich man's daughter falling in love with a poor boy and marrying him in defiance of her father. The tear-jerker then moves on to a train accident where the husband dies, and the girl adopts a young boy who lost his mother.

page49.title: Alor Pipasa
page49.description: A mother who is a dancer by profession wants to see his son successful man in future

page49.title: Bikele Bhorer Phul
page49.description: A famous poet and confirmed middle aged bachelor escapes to a resort, to avoid marriage proposals, and there he gets attracted to a teenage girl, who reciprocates, is it love or something else? Where will it end?

page49.title: Nakal Sona
page49.description: Bheble a struggling actor tries everything to get a role in a movie but even when he gets the role of a servant his patty is entirely edited out. Lata, a friend who found success as a singer helps him.

page49.title: Jighangsa
page49.description: The movie revolves with the unwanted incedents happened in princly state Ratnagarh. After the murder of the king Chandrakanta, one Dr. Palit (Kamal Mitra) asked for help to one Detective Smarajit Sen (Shisir Batabyal), as a family friend.

page50.title: Indira 1983
page50.description: Based on Bankimchandra Chattopadhyay’s novel, Indira is a great film casting Aparna Sen, Soumitra, another great on screen pair.

page50.title: Hotel Snow Fox
page50.description: Mithu Mukherjee belonged to a poor family. Her father was suffering from a chronic disease. They didn't have enough money to buy his medicines. Her father (Asit Baran)'s friend had cheated him due to which they had to mortgage even their house to him.

page50.title: Desh
page50.description: "Astha" is a dream project of freedom fighter Suprabha Chowdhury. She put her every effort to make it successful. Her only son Anjan who lived in Boston repeatedly requested his mother to go to States with him. After a long effort, Suprabha accepted Anjan's request.

page50.title: Mrinaler Chithi
page50.description: Story By Rabindranath Tagore.Story Based on Strir Patra Dialogue, Screenplay and Direction By Soumya Sarkar

page50.title: Monihar
page50.description: This story revolves around two brothers named Ajay, Arun and a lady named Bandana. Ajay the elder brother is a good singer by profession, and runs a business. After his mother's death, he takes all the responsibilty of his brother.

page50.title: Mem Saheb
page50.description: Kajal was popularly known as Memsaheb, intended as pun because of her dark complexion. She meets Amit, an unemployed wannabe journalist and fall in love. Like any other girl, Kajal dreams of a perfect married life.

page51.title: Maa
page51.description: The Bengali Film Maa Was Released In The Year 1984 Shobha Sen, Manjula Das, Utpal Dutta, Satya Banerjee, Shekhar Chattopadhyay, and Mrinal Ghosh. The Bengali Film Is Directed By Utpal Dutta. Prasanta Bhattacharya Scored the Music.

page51.title: Lukochuri
page51.description: Joy and Subho are two notorious thieves.Subho has a crush on Tia who also cons people. Joy has a crush on every girl he comes across. Meanwhile, a terrorist group aims to destroy all 3 star and 5-star hotels, but they have no arms.

page51.title: Lal Darja
page51.description: A dentist living in Calcutta suffers from delusions that start having an effect on his work and personal life. He is facinated with a driver, who is in a seemingly happy relationship with three women, and keeps seeing images of a mysterious red door.

page51.title: Gosainpur Sargaram
page51.description: Gosainpur Sargaram is a detective story written by Satyajit Ray starring his famous characters Feluda and Topshe

page51.title: Barnali
page51.description: A man mistakenly invites a family, whose girl was (and is still) betrothed to the groom. It was he who set up the cousin's alliance, would the girl forgive him, whom he had fallen in love? How to prevent her from attending the marriage?

page51.title: Rajbansha
page51.description: King of Maynamoti state Bhairav Singha is a noted womanizer. Pratap is his son, The results of Bhairav's illicit affair with a maid servant. After Pratap's birth, her mother was subsequently thrown out of the palace.

page52.title: Prithivi Amare Chai
page52.description: Prithbi amare chay' is a love oriented film. Tapash and Mala sinha are the main characters. Tapash and Rina both are from rich families. Because of soth's ? mother's bad behaviour, they came out form their house.

page52.title: Orajnoitik Noy
page52.description: A man lay dead on the road. The girl could have left the side, having seen the body, She went to a political leader for help but could not avail it. Minu's was a small family and her father was murdered by the political goons.

page52.title: Nidhiram Sardar
page52.description: A 1976 Suspense Thriller Bengali movie starring Uttam Kumar, Aparna Sen, Satya Bandyopadhyay, Robi Ghosh, Utpal Dutta, Tarun Kumar and Sushil Majumdar.

page52.title: Neem Annapurna
page52.description: Neem Annapurna is a 1979 Bengali film directed by Buddhadev Dasgupta and starring Sunil Mukherjee. The movie is based on Bengali short story, Neem Annapurna by Kamal Kumar Majumdar.

page52.title: Khoka Babur Pratyabartan
page52.description: A 1960 Bengali family drama starring Uttam Kumar, Asit Baran, Dipti Ray. Directed by Agradoot.

page52.title: Kankabatir Ghat
page52.description: A tragic story depicting and highlighting the disastrous destiny of the ethnic, eternal Indian woman "Kangkabotir Ghat".

page53.title: Gali Theke Rajpath
page53.description: Gali Theke Rajpath is a Comedy bengali movie, directed by Prafulla Chakraborty, starring Uttam Kumar, Sabitri Chattopadhyay, Chhabi Biswas, Chhaya Debi along with others.

page53.title: Shatabdir Galpo
page53.description: Shatabdir Galpo is a touching story of the decadence of our social values that results in the insurmountable hardships of the underprivileged one who lack the wealth, knowledge or power & have to sell their dignity to earn a decent living.

page53.title: Sanjher Pradip
page53.description: A 1955 Bengali movie starring Uttam Kumar, Suchitra Sen, Molina Debi, Chhaya Debi, Sabita Chatterjee, Bhanu Banerjee.

page53.title: Sanyasi Raja
page53.description: Surya Kishore Roy Chowdhury, the jamindar of a state was a man with a romantic bent of mind. He loved playing chess. His wife Indu thought that he never cared about her but her opinion was wrong.

page53.title: Sandhya Deeper Sikha
page53.description: Captain Anupam and his newly wed wife Jayanti make a happy couple. Policeman Ashraf and reporter Tarun are their close friends. They live in Lucknow and life goes on happily until one day China invokes war with India.

page53.title: Kalankita Nayak
page53.description: A renowned social worker of the old bengali culture has been conspired against by the landlord of the village to create criticism against him before the public to hide his crimes.

page54.title: Brotacharini
page54.description: Bratacharini is a Family bengali movie, directed by Kamal Gangopadhyay, starring Uttam Kumar, Sandhyarani, Anubha Gupta, Sabitri Chattopadhyay along with others.

page54.title: Bisarjan
page54.description: A 1974 Bengali movie starring Nripati Chattyopadhyay, Utpal Dutta, Ajitesh Bandyopadhyay.

page54.title: Sei Chokh
page54.description: In the beginning of the movie, we find Nabakrishna in a mental home. His uncle Prankrishna and his aunt, both unmarried are very much worried about their nephew's mental health. They decide to bring him back to his home, but impose certain restrictions.

page54.title: Bidhilipi
page54.description: Bidhilipi is a bengali movie, directed by Manu Sen, starring Uttam Kumar, Sandhyarani, Sabitri Chattopadhyay, Chhabi Biswas along with others.

page54.title: Shilpi (Bengali)
page54.description: Shilpi (The Artist) is a 1994 Bengali film.The film was directed by Nabyendu Chattopadhyay. The film was produced by National Film Development Corporation of India.

page54.title: Rajkanya
page54.description: Rajkanya is a 1965 Bengali film directed by Sunil Bandyopadhyay. The movie was based on a story and screenplay by legendary film director Ritwik Ghatak. Uttam Kumar, Rina Ghosh, Bhanu Bandopadhyay, and Tarun Kumar portray the main characters.

page56.title: Dibratrir Kabya
page56.description: A Bengali black-and-white film starring Madhabi Mukherjee, Anjana Bhowmik and Basant Choudhury in the lead roles. The film was directed by Bimal Bhowmik and Narayan Chakraborty. The film won two National Film Awards at the 17th National Film Awards.

page56.title: Dhuli
page56.description: Dhuli is a Drama, Family bengali movie, directed by Pinaki Mukherjee, starring Chhabi Biswas, Suchitra Sen, Anil Chatterjee, Jahar Roy along with others

page56.title: Punarmilan
page56.description: Punarmilan is a Drama, Family, Romance bengali movie, directed by Manu Sen, starring Uttam Kumar, Manju Dey, Tarun Kumar, Anil Chatterjee along with others.

page56.title: Kichhu Sanglap Kichhu Prolap
page56.description: The film is mostly based on Kalkata's gossip in Indian Coffee House of College Street, the relationship between two young couple and outside the film will probably appeal to communists and the intellectuals of Kolkata city in that time.

page56.title: Kashinath
page56.description: "Shiromoni" was the priest of the village. He had lost his wife. He had only one son Kashinath. One day as he fell ill he sent Kashinath to the Mukherjee house for daily worshipping. When Kashinath returned home he found his father dead.

page56.title: Josh (Bengali)
page56.description: A remake of Ravi Teja's Blockbuster Telugu film Bhadra.Indra and Rajib are the thickest of friends studying in the same college. When Indra comes to the city to visit Rajib, Indra notices Rajib's sister, Anu, and is attracted to her instantly.

page57.title: Jadi Jantem
page57.description: Jadi Jantem is a Bengali suspense Thriller film directed by Yatrik. This movie was released in 1 March 1974 in the banner of Chitrajug. Uttam Kumar played the role of main protagonist of the movie, Mr. P. K. Basu, Bar-at-law.

page57.title: Raktamukhi Neela
page57.description: The film is about the murder of actress Neela Sen on the sets of an under production film, named “Raktamukhi Neela”. Neela Sen is found dead in her room.

page57.title: Ganga
page57.description: Ganga is a 1960 Bengali film directed by Rajen Tarafdar. This film narrates the life of river fishermen. This film was made under Cine Art Productions Pvt. Ltd. banner. The music of this film was composed by Salil Chowdhury.

page57.title: Saat Pake Bandha
page57.description: A man agrees to an arranged marriage, but with an unusual qualification. A remake of 1996 Telugu movie Pavitra Bandham .

page57.title: Ki Kore Toke Bolbo
page57.description: A woman wants to divorce her husband, but is forced to live with him for six months first. Will she long to be with the one she loves, or will she learn to love the one she's with?

page57.title: Power (Bengali)
page57.description: A man who was the look-alike of an honest police officer in his previous life is eager to join the police. He gets the opportunity, and what follows next is a thrilling ride of comedy with action.

page58.title: Shudhu Tomari Jonyo
page58.description: A Remake of Tamil successful 2013 movie Raja Rani.Newlyweds who hate each other come to terms with each other and their past.

page58.title: Belaseshe
page58.description: A story of relationships that explores the intricacies of the married life, of life-long companionship, of promises and expectations and love.

page58.title: Cinemawala
page58.description: Digital cinema threatens the survival of a small town movie theater in West Bengal, leading to a tussle between the owner and his son.

page58.title: Anusandhan
page58.description: A man (Amitabh Bachchan) must deal with a vicious criminal (Amjad Khan) who attacked his blind wife (Rakhee Gulzar).

page58.title: Mansur Miyar Ghora
page58.description: It revolves around the archetypal character of old and constant Mansur Mian and his obsession for his landau that was handed down to him by his ancestors, and a horse as old as himself.

page58.title: Louhakapat
page58.description: Louhakapat is a bengali movie, directed by Tapan Sinha, starring Chhabi Biswas, Anil Chatterjee, Bhanu Bandyopadhyay, Jahar Roy along with others.

page59.title: Laptop (2012)
page59.description: From a doctor at an infertility clinic to a taxi driver via the son of a hotel manager, the laptop travels to a visually challenged author, his typist and subsequently, to a publisher in search of the kid born as a result of his sperm donation.

page59.title: Mahulbanir Sereng
page59.description: A police constable's wife gets involved with a doctor in the village while he is away for work. She gets pregnant and commits suicide when confronted by the village heads for promiscuity; the doctor flees with the help of another woman.

page59.title: Marjina Abdulla
page59.description: Marjina Abdulla is a 1973 Bengali film directed by Dinen Gupta.This film has bean music directed by Salil Choudhury.The film starring Gita Dey, Utpal Dutt, Santosh Dutta, Mithu Mukherjee and Debraj Ray in the lead roles.

page59.title: Maraner Pare
page59.description: Maraner Pare is a Drama bengali movie, directed by Satish Dasgupta, starring Uttam Kumar, Suchitra Sen, Bharati Debi, Dhiraj Bhattacharya along with others

page59.title: Lal Pathar
page59.description: A group of tourist meet with a old man in Fatepur Sikri of Agra & that old man narrated the story to them. This is a story that took place 35 years back.

page59.title: Anand Ashram
page59.description: A wealthy Indian man expects his son to marry a woman of equally high status, but the son falls in love with a poor woman.

page60.title: Ami Shubhash Bolchi
page60.description: Debabrata Bose, a laid back middle-class Bengali man, fights for change, and in the process awakens the late Bengali patriot, Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose, who tries to help him rouse Bengalis to action.

page60.title: Lalan Fakir
page60.description: The Bengali Film Lalan Fakir was released in the year 1987 Directed by Shakti Chattopadhyay, starring: Sandhya Roy, Mahua Roychowdhury, Dipti Ray, Padma Debi, Shibani Basu, Asit Baran.

page60.title: Ami Se O Sakha
page60.description: A 1975 Bengali movie starring Uttam Kumar, Anil Chatterjee, Kaberi Basu, Basabi Nandi, Arati Bhattacharya, Asit Baran, Tarun Kumar. The movie was directed by Mangal Chakraborty.

page60.title: Buno Haansh
page60.description: Amal works as a security guard in a mall and is tempted by the world of wealth surrounding him. When a close friend introduces him to the underworld element, he becomes trapped in a web of greed, lust, and crime.

page60.title: Baishe Srabon
page60.description: An ex-cop is hired to track down a serial killer who carries out his killings according to Bengali poetry.

page60.title: Laboratory
page60.description: "Laboratory" is about Sohini, a girl from Punjab who married Bengali scientist Nandakishore. Following Nandakishore's untimely death, it fell upon Sohini to fulfill her husband's dream.

page61.title: Yugant
page61.description: Deepak (Anjan Dutt) and Anasuya (Roopa Ganguly) are an estranged couple, now leading separate lives in Cuttack and Bombay. They meet again after 18 months of separation, at a small fishing village where they had once honeymooned.

page61.title: Gorosthaney Sabdhan
page61.description: Three friends investigate the vandalism of a grave and the theft of a clock. It is based on the novel of the same name by Satyajit Ray.

page61.title: Marutirtha Hinglaj
page61.description: Based on the travelouge by Avadhoot, Marutirtha Hinglaj is a film about a pilgrimage to Hinglaj, now in Pakistan. A group of pilgrims are undertaking a pilgrimage to the sacred Temple, which is revered by Hindus and Muslims alike.

page61.title: Naa
page61.description: A 1952 Bengali Movie starring Sandhyarani, Molina Devi. Directed by Sri Tarashankar.

page61.title: Rangbaaz
page61.description: A remake of the 2007 Telugu film Chirutha.A vow of revenge takes a young man and woman to a remote island. Raj is on a mission to avenge his father’s death. He meets Madhu and the two find themselves thrown together as Raj hunts for the killer.

page61.title: Sesh Anka
page61.description: A widower is about to marry a woman when another woman enters the scene claiming to be his first-wife.

page62.title: Kagojer Bou
page62.description: Subimal, hungry for sex beyond marriage, tries to convince Priti, a sultry young model, that her current boyfriend is two-timing her. Upal asks Ketaki to sleep with the boyfriend knowing that the young girl, hungry for love, loves him.

page62.title: Ramdhanu
page62.description: Mitali was a worried mother. This time, once again, her 5-year-old son Gogol had failed to pass the admission test in a reputed school and his application was rejected.The movie was remade in Bollywood as Hindi Medium.

page62.title: Obhishopto Nighty
page62.description: A cursed nightie changes hands, in each case making the wearer fall in love and avenge the death of the nightie's original owner.

page62.title: Sonar Kella
page62.description: A young boy becomes a target for crooks, after he claims to remember his past life and mentions precious jewels in a golden fortress.

page62.title: Unishe April
page62.description: Aditi comes home for a few days as her mother is being awarded an important prize.Directed by Rituparno Ghosh

page62.title: Saheb
