page62.description: Saheb a jovial, friendly, and kindhearted boy loved to play football. He was very much neglected by his brothers. Only his sister-in-law and his only sister Bulti appreciated and took care about him.

page63.title: Hangsaraj
page63.description: Hansraj was a village singer. One morning when he was singing in the fields, he saw a group of boys. They came near him when they heard his songs. One of the boys, Danny gave hopes to Hansraj of making him a singer in Kolkata.

page63.title: Pankhiraj
page63.description: A 1980 Bengali Movie starring Uttam Kumar, Soumitra Chatterjee, Utpal Dutt, Samit Bhanja, Tarun Kumar, Chinmoy Roy, Anamika Saha, Robin Banerjee

page63.title: Sadanander Mela
page63.description: Few homeless people take shelter in an empty luxurious house under the leading of a strange man.

page63.title: Strir Patra
page63.description: Strir Patra is a 1972 Bengali film, directed by Purnendu Patri, based on a short story by Rabindranath Tagore, and with Madhabi Mukherjee playing the lead role.

page63.title: Family Album
page63.description: This is a movie that exposes the not-so picture-perfect Family Album...a hilarious and sad and eccentric concoction of the truth.

page63.title: Ghatkali
page63.description: Pravanjan Haldar was a professional matchmaker. He and his uncle Bhombal did this business together. One day Niladri's grandfather called Bhombal and asked him to find a perfect match for his grandson.

page65.title: Shubho Mahurat
page65.description: An actress mysteriously dies after the "Shubho Mahurat," a celebration of the first shot of the film. A journalist and her perceptive aunt investigate.

page65.title: Shyamali
page65.description: Shyamali a 1956 Indian film directed by Ajoy Kar and stars Kaberi Bose as the title character Shyamali. Uttam Kumar stars in this movie as the actor.

page65.title: Saheb Bibi Golam
page65.description: A Zamindar neglects his wife and prefers the company of alcohol and dancing girls. The decadence of the Bangali Zamindar milieu and the raising bourgeoisie in the late 19th century.

page65.title: Siddhanta
page65.description: Anjan and Nabanita are both college students who fall in love. Anjan is also involved in politics and comes to contact with Abani who is against the ideology of the party. Nabanita and Abani forms a party to fight for the cause of the common people.

page65.title: Sagarika
page65.description: Arun, a bright medical student, wants to fulfill his dad's last wish to go to England and become a doctor and come back to treat the village folk. He stayed in Shipra's house.

page65.title: Sabuj Dwiper Raja
page65.description: Sabuj Dwiper Raja is a 1979 Indian adventure thriller film directed by Tapan Sinha, based on the fictional character Kakababu created by Sunil Gangopadhyay.

page66.title: Sabar Uparey
page66.description: Sabar Uparey is a 1955 Indian Bengali film noir directed by Agradoot, based on A.J. Cronin's 1953 novel, Beyond This Place. It starred acclaimed actors Uttam Kumar and Suchitra Sen in leading roles.

page66.title: Shriman Prithviraj
page66.description: Shriman Prithviraj is a 1972 Indian Bengali romantic comedy film starring Ayan Banerjee and Mahua Roy Choudhury, and directed by Tarun Majumdar, featuring teenage love. It has a cult following.

page66.title: Sthaniya Sambaad
page66.description: A film on Kolkata that constantly juggles between the real and hallucinatory, between serious observations and wry humor, between familiarity and unexplored spaces of human existence.

page66.title: Story Of Pather Panchali
page66.description: An exploration and examination of the making of "Pather Panchali". The documentary has Satyajit Ray’s original voice. Participated in various festivals.

page66.title: Subarnalata
page66.description: A 1981 Bengali Movie starring Madhabi Mukherjee, Mahuya Roy, Nirmal Kumar.

page66.title: Subhash Chandra
page66.description: Child Subhash (Master Ashish Ghosh) is an intelligent guy who loves his motherland. He gets admitted to school, where he came second. All his teachers and his headmaster appreciate the little guy's intelligence and his bravery.

page67.title: Surya Toran
page67.description: A 1958 Bengali Movie starring Uttam Kumar, Suchitra Sen, Chhabi Biswas, Bikash Roy, Asit Baran, Kamal Mitra, Kali Banerjee, Tulsi Chakrabarty.

page67.title: Swapner Feriwala
page67.description: Swapner Feriwala is a soothing fantasy in the pursuit of the last magical charms in our modern, urban lives. It's a symbolic story of youthful and vigorous rebellion against age-old orthodoxy and religious fanaticism.

page67.title: Swarga Martya
page67.description: Swarga Martya is a Comedy, Drama, Fantasy bengali movie, directed by Asim Pal, starring Bhanu Bandyopadhyay, Nripati Chattyopadhyay, Tarun Kumar, Tulsi Chakraborty along with others.

page67.title: Swayam Siddha
page67.description: Swayamsiddha fights against injustice and crime. The king Raja decided to make her his daughter-in-law. However when the marriage date drew close, she realised that the king's son Govinda was mentally challenged.

page67.title: Swet Patharer Thala
page67.description: After becoming a widow, Bandhana (Aparna Sen) falls in love with her son's mentor after moving into an orphanage.

page67.title: Tahader Katha
page67.description: Shibnath is released from prison after eleven years of incarceration for murdering a British officer.

page68.title: Rupkatha Noy
page68.description: Five young people are driven by primal human instincts - to escape, find thrill, seek revenge or wait for destiny. And one old wizened man is trying to touch upon their minds.

page68.title: Take One
page68.description: Actress Doel Mitra (Swastika Mukherjee) is caught within fierce criticism and judgments when her intimate scene for a foreign film leaks on the internet.

page68.title: Takhan Teish
page68.description: This is the story of a sensitive 27-year-old doctor, Tamodeep, whose life changes drastically in just 48 hours. He comes across four women and they steer him through a journey of affection, infatuation, lust, friendship and true feelings.

page68.title: Teen Bhubaner Pare
page68.description: A street romeo stalks a girl, highly educated and above in social ladder. She falls in love, marries, and changes him, forcing him to study and leave his friends. He feels suffocated. He reaches top, and gets a chance to break free.,

page68.title: Rajkumari
page68.description: Manju's mother was very strictly disciplined. One day Manju listen singing form Nirmal and She fell in love. Nirmal went to Manju's mother and said to her mother that he wanted to sing the song of Manju. But Manju's mother refused his proposal.

page68.title: Teen Kanya
page68.description: Based on popular Indian stories of great writer Rabindra Nath Tagore, these short films reveal definitive moments in the lives of three young girls.

page69.title: Raja-Saja
page69.description: A simple tale of a happy go lucky village master whose world turns upside down when an estate manager arrives at his village, one day, informing him that he is the inheritor of a very large fortune left behind by his uncle and he must leave for Kolkata.

page69.title: Thagini
page69.description: A 1974 Bengali Movie starring Utpal Dutta, Anup Kumar, Jahar Roy, Sandhya Roy, Rabi Ghosh, Ajitesh Benerjee, Chinmoy Roy.

page69.title: Proloy
page69.description: A man creates a forum to address the brutal gang rapes happening in his village, persuading the law to take action. Culprits are arrested, but he is murdered and the criminals go free; then his friend avenges his death.

page69.title: The Japanese Wife
page69.description: The story revolves around a young Bengali village school teacher (Rahul Bose) marrying his Japanese pen friend (Chigusa Takaku) over letters and remaining true and loyal to her throughout his life, while actually never meeting her.

page69.title: Tintorettor Jishu
page69.description: Feluda, the famous Bengali detective tackles an international buyer, a corrupt arts agent, numerous henchmen and impostors in this story that revolves around a painting of Jesus by the famous Italian painter Tintoretto.

page69.title: Pratidwandi
page69.description: A young college graduate is struggling to find a job. He lives in a flat with his younger, employed sister, revolutionary brother and widowed mother. The strain of the situation ultimately causes him to hallucinate

page70.title: Upahar
page70.description: Kangalicharan who is so obsessed with making money chooses money over his family. His son and wife die because he could not provide proper medication and treatment on time which he did not provide.

page70.title: Prothom Kadam Phool
page70.description: Prothom Kadam Phool is a 1969 Bengali film directed by Inder Sen. It stars Tanuja and Soumitra Chatterjee in the lead.

page70.title: Phatik Chand
page70.description: Mystery-drama about a botched kidnapping of a Calcutta schoolboy and his relationships and adventures.

page70.title: Personal Assistant
page70.description: Ramapoda Dutta gets a job in an all-female company as the personal assistant to the Managing Director.

page70.title: Pathey Holo Deri
page70.description: An MBBS doctor falls in love with the granddaughter of a rich man. She helps him to pursue the dream of her love to do higher studies by giving him her mother's Jewellery.

page70.title: Pather Panchali
page70.description: Impoverished priest Harihar Ray, dreaming of a better life for himself and his family, leaves his rural Bengal village in search of work.

page71.title: Patalghar
page71.description: A gang of criminals was searching for an ancient sleeping machine in old houses.Patalghar is a Bengali science fiction film based on the story of same name by Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay.

page71.title: Paromitar Ek Din
page71.description: This film is exploring the dual themes of friendship and loneliness. Sanaka and Paromita are mother and daughter-in-law who, despite differences in age, backgrounds and temperaments, build a strong bond together.

page71.title: Palatak
page71.description: Basanta Chatterjee, is the younger brother of a rich zamindar Hemanta. Hemanta is known by his nick name Angti. Angti & his wife, a childless couple, loves Basanta as their own off-spring. Basanta, a good singer & musician also is a borne traveller.

page71.title: Painter Rabindranath
page71.description: Documentary film on the life and works of Rabindranath Tagore as a painter .

page71.title: Padma Nadir Majhi
page71.description: Hossain, a Bengali Muslim wants to establish a little Utopia on an island in the Padma delta. He doesn't care if the people who populate it are Hindu or Muslim.

page71.title: Padatik
page71.description: A Naxalite revolutionary escapes police custody and begins to question his beliefs whilst hiding out in a luxury apartment.

page72.title: Ora Thake Odhare
page72.description: This story revolves around the contemporary fights between the bangal and ghoti in 50's West Bengal. Just after the partition, refugees were coming from east-Pakistan-they are bangal. The old residents of West bengal are ghatis.

page72.title: Oh! Henry
page72.description: The unusual plot revolves around three individuals, Megh (Locket), Akash (Dibyendu) and Brishti (Pooja), who end up in a situation that spirals out of their control, when Megh finds Akash to be the exact shadow of her novel's hero, Henry.

page72.title: Nobel Chor
page72.description: A poor farmer finds a stolen medal and tries to return it until a friend convinces him to sell it in Kolkatta. This movie is loosely based on the sensational robbery of Rabindranath Tagore's Nobel Prize Winning Medal.

page72.title: Nishijapon
page72.description: A family gets alienated in a mountain forest villa after an earthquake. After 3 days of starvation, the true nature of each character begins to reveal.

page72.title: Nirjan Saikate
page72.description: On his way to Puri by train,the Writer gets acquainted with a group of 4 Bengali widows accompanying with their niece.

page72.title: Nirdharita Shilpir Anupasthitite
page72.description: An unseen movie of Bhanu Bandopadhyay. The film also stars his real-life daughter Basabi. In the film, they play father and daughter who get separated and unite later, and then the daughter has problem adjusting with her father's rich background.

page73.title: Nimantran
page73.description: A boy from Calcutta (Anup Kumar), while on a visit to his aunt in her village, falls in love with a girl (Sandhya Roy) , what follows is a story of love, longing and sacrifice. One of the finest movies of Indian Cinema.

page73.title: Nishi Padma
page73.description: Nishi Padma is a 1970 Bengali drama film written and directed by Aravinda Mukherjee, based on a short story Hinger Kochuri by Bibhutibhushan Bandopadhyay, and starring Uttam Kumar and Sabitri Chatterjee as leads.

page73.title: Nil Nirjane
page73.description: It is the first movie in India that was shot on a digital platform and is often credited as the first digital film in north India.Nil Nirjane created lots of controversies with the purists terming it "outrageous" for the lesbian and sex scenes.

page73.title: Neel Akasher Neechey
page73.description: Set in the background of the last days of the British Raj in Calcutta, the film explores the lives of a number of characters, including the platonic relationship between an immigrant Chinese wage worker, Wang Lu, and the main female character called Basanti.

page73.title: Nagordola
page73.description: A dysfunctional family endures chronic illness, unplanned pregnancy, emotional instability, inappropriate affairs, and a host of other issues.

page73.title: Mallick Bari
page73.description: The film is centered on the different occupants (from time to time) of a portion of a palatial house.It seems tragedy befalls every occupant of that particular portion in some way or the other.

page74.title: Kari Diye Kinlam
page74.description: The film Kari Diye Kinlam is set in the backdrop of preindependent India. People of Bengal specially the men were preparing themselves into perfect human beings, free from all possible prejudices.

page74.title: Kony
page74.description: Koni is a national award winning Bengali movie released in 1986 directed by Saroj Dey, starring Soumitra Chatterjee and Sriparna Banerjee. This film is an adaptation of a Bengali novel by the same name written by Moti Nandi.

page74.title: Kshudhita Pashan
page74.description: A tax collector stays in a haunted mansion and falls in love with the building and its ghost.

page74.title: Khokababu
page74.description: Khokababu is the story of Firdaus who essays the role of an underworld Don who lives in Kolkata along with his sister Pooja.Dev alias Khokhababu is an aimless youngster.This film is a remake of a Telugu film, Dhee.

page74.title: Khoka 420
page74.description: The film is a remake of the 2010 Telugu film Brindavanam.The story of the film revolves around Krish who is in love with two girls Bhoomi and Megha. He is in dilemma who he has to chose for his bride to be.

page74.title: Khiladi (2013)
page74.description: This film is a remake of the 1999 Malayalam film Udayapuram Sulthan.Aditya Choudhury is a faction leader in Kurnool who raised his sister Saraswati with love and affection to make her forget the loss of their mother.

page75.title: Khelaghar
page75.description: Khelaghar' is one of the renowned movies of Uttam kumar and Mala sinha. The story starts with the scene where Goutam chatterjee is escaping from jail. Goutam is a freedom fighter and political leader.

page75.title: Khela
page75.description: Khela is a Bengali film by Rituparno Ghosh. The film is about an idealistic director's quench to make a film with a boy who he thinks is just perfect for the role.

page75.title: Khaniker Atithi
page75.description: A 1959 Bengali movie starring  Nirmal Kumar, Chhabi Biswas, Anil Chatterjee, Dilip Roy, Tulsi Lahiri. Director: Tapan Sinha Music Director: Hemant Kumar

page75.title: Khaad
page75.description: It's about a story of a group of people trying to make-out alive of a situation that tests their strength, patience, and resilience.

page75.title: Kancher Swarga
page75.description: A story about a young man, who had to quit his studies as a doctor due to difficult circumstances, coming back and saving a young lady by performing a very difficult surgery.

page75.title: Kanchenjungha
page75.description: An upper-class Bengali family is on vacation in Darjeeling, a popular hill station and resort near Kanchenjungha.

page76.title: Kanamachi
page76.description: This film is a remake of Tamil successful film Ko.A young photojournalist gets entangled in a political conspiracy when he witnesses Naxalites robbing a local bank.

page76.title: Kabuliwala
page76.description: Rahmat a middle-aged fruit seller from Afghanistan, comes to Calcutta to hawk his merchandise and befriends a small Bengali girl called Mini.

page76.title: Jukti Takko Aar Gappo
page76.description: After losing his wife and being forced from his home, a disillusioned man wanders through the countryside, meeting unusual people along the way.

page76.title: Jiban Trishna
page76.description: Jiban Trishna is a 1957 Bengali film directed by Asit Sen.This film under the banner Badal Pictures.The film has bean music composed by Bhupen Hazarika.The film starring Uttam Kumar and Suchitra Sen in the lead roles.

page76.title: Jiban Saikate
page76.description: Jiban Saikate is a 1972 Bengali film based on the novel The Citadel by A. J. Cronin. It was directed by Swadesh Sarkar and stars Soumitra Chatterjee, Aparna Sen and Dilip Roy.

page76.title: Joy Jayanti
page76.description: Jayanti Bose (Aparna Sen) takes up the job of governess in Roy villa against the wishes of her family. She has to look after five extremely naughty children, the nephews and nieces of Sanjoy Roy (Uttam Kumar), a rich and arrogant man.

page77.title: Jatu Griha
page77.description: Satadal (Uttam Kumar) is a civil engineer with a successful career and a loving wife Madhuri (Arundhati Devi). However, their relationship runs into rough weather from the emotional stress and strain of childlessness.

page77.title: Jana Aranya
page77.description: Recent college graduate Somnath (Pradip Mukherjee) is having a rough time finding a job. In desperation, he sets up shop as a middleman, buying goods at low prices and reselling them to businesses at a profit.

page77.title: Jomalaye Jibanta Manush
page77.description: When the messengers of 'Yamraj'- God of Death - mistakenly bring an alive, honest person to hell, he starts a revolution to fix outdated rules of heaven and hell.

page77.title: Jalsaghar
page77.description: Indian landowner Biswambhar Roy lives in luxury, but his fortune is slowly slipping away. Despite his decreasing funds, Roy insists on maintaining his lavish lifestyle, particularly his ornate music room, which he utilizes as a performance space.

page77.title: Jadu Bansha
page77.description: A political film reflecting the turbulent times of the '60s and '70s.

page77.title: Jaatishwar
page77.description: The life and notable works of Anthony Firingee a 19th century Bengali language folk poet of Portuguese origin.The time frame of the storyline jumps between two different time periods 19th century and the present day.

page78.title: Iti Srikanto
page78.description: The film is a love triangle between a young man Srikanta (Adil Hussain) and two women in his life, Rajalakshmi (Reema Sen) a rich courtesan and Kamalata (Soha Ali Khan), a vaishnavite living in an ashram.

page78.title: Interview
page78.description: Ranjit Mallick is a smart personable young man. A friend of the family, who works in a foreign firm, has assured him of a lucrative job in his firm. All Ranjit has to do is to appear in an interview, dressed in a western style suit.

page78.title: Indrani
page78.description: Indrani, a brilliant student from a village, wants to study in Calcutta. She takes admission in a college and hostel in Calcutta. Her room partner is Jayanti. Soon they become intimate friends.

page78.title: Hospital
page78.description: Sarbari and Saibal were both successful doctors and in love . Saibal comes from a very affluent family while Sarbari has to provide for her poverty- striken family and her invalid but principled father .

page78.title: Hirak Rajar Deshe
page78.description: Goofy musicians Goopy (Tapan Chatterjee) and Bagha (Rabi Ghosh) help a teacher (Soumitra Chatterjee) stop a kingdom's exploitation of farmers and diamond miners.

page78.title: Highway (Bengali)
page78.description: Aswin Kapoor (Parambrata) and his wife Sabitri (Koel) start a game on their way to Darjeeling in which both act as strangers.

page79.title: Headmaster
page79.description: Headmaster is a Drama bengali movie, directed by Agragami, starring Chhabi Biswas, Dilip Mukhopadhyay, Santosh Dutta, Karuna Bandyopadhyay along with others.

page79.title: Hawa Bodol
page79.description: The film starts with a typically urban couple where the advances of the husband are turned down by a very hot but albeit tired wife. As the glass of water in Jeet's hand transforms to that of a whiskey glass in Raj's hand, the laughter riot starts.

page79.title: Harano Sur
page79.description: Harano Sur is a 1957 Indian Bengali romantic drama film by Ajoy Kar, starring Suchitra Sen and Uttam Kumar, with music by Hemanta Mukherjee, and sung by Geeta Dutt.

page79.title: Har Mana Har
page79.description: This story revolves around Nira and Binu. Nira had lost her parents in early childhood. She was brought up by her uncle and aunt. On the day of her marriage she came to know that the person with whom she was getting married already had a wife and a child.

page79.title: Sanjhbatir Rupkathara
page79.description: Sanjhbati 's father perceived an aura about her and used to paint a picture of hers on every birthday. However one day her father is caught in a compromising position with a lady friend, and her mother cannot survive her shock.

page79.title: Shilpi
page79.description: A homeless boy fell in love with his owner's girl. Starring Uttam Kumar, Suchitra Sen, Pahadi Sanyal, Sikharani Bag, Molina Devi, Kamal Mitra, Sova Sen.

page80.title: Shap Mochan
page80.description: Mhanedra is a descendant of a musician family. One of his forefathers was cursed by his guru that anyone in his family who would practice music will either die prematurely or be disabled because he insulted the guru by not accepting him as the guru.

page80.title: Subarnarekha
page80.description: A man (Abhi Bhattacharya) opposes the love between his sister and the orphan (Satindra Bhattacharya) they adopted years earlier.

page80.title: Goyenda Gogol
page80.description: Goenda Gogol is a Bengali children`s movie.Gogol, a grade VI student, sets out to Puri to spend his summer holidays with his mother and U.S. returned  father and come across a haunted house.

page80.title: Grihadaha
page80.description: Suresh & Mahim were two childhood friends, but there was vast difference between their livelihood and religion. Mahim was a poor guy with a small hut and little bit of land left back in his village.

page80.title: Goynar Baksho
page80.description: The matriarch of a displaced family spends her life as a chaste widow and hides her wedding jewels from her greedy relatives.

page80.title: Gopal Bhanar
page80.description: A 1980 Bengali movie Starring Santosh Dutta, Robi Ghosh, Tarun Kumar, Asit Baran, Mrinal Mukherjee, Lily Chakraborty, Nirmal Kumar.

page81.title: Titash Ekti Nadir Naam
page81.description: Titas Ekti Nadir Naam, or A River Called Titas, is a 1973 Bangladeshi film directed by Ritwik Ghatak. The movie was based on a novel by the same name, written by Adwaita Mallabarman.

page81.title: Thana Theke Aschi
page81.description: Sub-Inspector Tinkari Haldar comes to the house of the Industrialist Chandra Madhab Sen to inquire about a Suicide and Mystery starts to Unfold.

page81.title: Vidyasagar
page81.description: This movie is based on the life of a famous Bengali philosopher, academic educator, writer, translator, printer, publisher, entrepreneur, reformer, and philanthropist named Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar.

page81.title: Wheel Chair
page81.description: Wheel Chair is a Bengali feature film that is about a crippled doctor who helps a paralyzed rape victim. The film is inspired by the life of a crusading doctor. The doctor is the protagonist who is handicapped and on a wheel chair.

page81.title: Ek Mutho Chabi
page81.description: The movie does not tell one continuous story over 90 minutes; rather it's a compilation of six different stories combined together, all of around 20–25 minutes duration. All directed by different directors.

page81.title: Dutta Vs Dutta
page81.description: Dutta vs Dutta is a hilarious, dramatic and passionate film about people and a time that once was very real.About a period in Kolkata`s history, the film is a coming of age film about a crazy father and equally crazy son.

page82.title: Chhayamoy
page82.description: Indra Pratap a heir of a kingdom called Raidighi,comes to India for the first time to find the hidden treasure of his ancestors.This was a children's film with supernatural elements in it.

page82.title: Ek Je Aachhe Kanya
page82.description: A mentally unstable girl gets obsessed with the new tenant. The story deals with how the tenant and his fiancée deals with this obsession.

page82.title: Doctor
page82.description: The story, happening in a Bengal village, had the con­flict between a father and son as its main thematic and dramatic point.

page82.title: Chaowa Pawa
page82.description: Chaowa Pawa is a 1959 Indian Bengali comedy drama film directed by Yatrik. The film is starring Uttam Kumar and Suchitra Sen.

page82.title: Chowringhee
page82.description: The movie revolves around different characters - hotel employees to page 3 personalities dealing different human emotions.

page82.title: Ekti Raat
page82.description: Ekti Raat is a movie about two couples and their relationship. Sushabhan Dutta and his wife, Anita, were invited at Digbijay babu's place.

page83.title: Chhutir Phande
page83.description: Chhutir Phande is a Comedy, Romance bengali movie, directed by Salil Sen, starring Soumitra Chatterjee, Aparna Sen, Jahar Roy, Robi Ghosh.

page83.title: Cheley Kaar
page83.description: Jogin, a poor school teacher, had brought up an orphan Tomato as his nephew. But now suffering from the deadly tubercolosis, he decided to gamble with luck to see if a better home could be found for Tomato.

page83.title: Ekhane Pinjar
page83.description: The story revolves around a novelist called Amal(Uttam Kumar)and his entertainment with a truncated antisocial Nabendu,(Dilip Mukherjee) his death and its aftermaths.

page83.title: Dui Prithibi
page83.description: Rahul, the son of a very rich man who has lost his love sets out on a journey and discovers his life anew in the process.A remake of the Telugu film Gamyam.The biggest stars of Bengali cinema, Jeet, and Dev,seen together for the only time on the celluloid.

page83.title: Chotoder Chobi
page83.description: Focusing on the predicaments of those born with a genetic defect causing dwarfism, the film is the love story between Khoka and Soma.The plot revolves around the lives and opinions of a group of dwarfs who work as jokers in a circus.

page83.title: Chalo Paltai
page83.description: This film is based on the Marathi film "Shikshanachya Aaicha Gho!". The film revolves around the relations between a father and a son.

page84.title: Chitrangada
page84.description: Chitraganda: The Crowning Wish, is a lusciously lit and deeply personal drama about a choreographer considering a gender-reassignment surgery. The film also explores insights into how gender expression can affect families.

page84.title: Faltu
page84.description: It is the story of a 20-year-old orphan called Faltu and his search for the man who has fathered him. This is also the account of a village and its people, woven around a narrative with myriad moments and a lot of dramatic events.

page84.title: Eti
page84.description: The story of the film is based on a well known true story. It's a tragic love-story of a young couple. They were engaged in love-making and unfortunately they recorded the act in a video-cam.

page84.title: Dosar
page84.description: The story revolves around Kaushik and Kaberi, a happy couple until a car accident takes away Mita, Kaushik's mistress and leaves Kaushik heavily injured.(Black and White film)

page84.title: Damadol
page84.description: Nikhil, Aditya and VK (Shaheb Bhattacherjee, Samadarshi Dutta and Rajdeep Gupta) are best friends. But all hell breaks lose when, to protect their self-images, they keep little secrets from each other.

page84.title: Bariwali
page84.description: A lonely middle-aged woman agrees to let her house out to a film crew; soon, she finds herself drawn towards the charming director, who exploits her to suit his purpose.

page85.title: Broja Buli
page85.description: A 1979 Bengali movie starring Uttam Kumar, Sabitri Chatterjee, Jahar Ray, Robi Ghosh, Chinmoy Roy, Tarun Kumar, Dilip Roy, Chhaya Devi, Nimu Bhowmick, Santosh Dutta.

page85.title: Charuulata 2011
page85.description: This film is based on Rabindranath Tagore's novel "Nastanirh".Chaiti is a young beautiful woman and wife of newspaper editor Bikramjit. Bikramjit is a workaholic and always stay busy with his editorial works.

page85.title: Chalo Let's Go
page85.description: This is a story about four friends who studied at the same school. They started a Bengali band, but they were beaten up by the public at a stage show in North Bengal.At this point, they start a travel agency, called 'Gharoa Travels'.

page85.title: Bilambita Loy
page85.description: A promising artist and a singer fall in love in college and get married against their families wishes. The singer starts to perform to support her husband and becomes nationally known.

page85.title: Barjatri
page85.description: This hilarious comedy revolves around the desperate search of a bride for the protagonist Ganesh (Kali Banerjee) by his friends.

page85.title: Chandidas
page85.description: The story revolves around the 15th-century poet-saint Chandidas who acts out against the deep-rooted bigotry against caste, untouchability and the hypocrisy of society and a washerwoman with whom he falls in love.

page86.title: Bibaha Bibhrat
page86.description: The Bengali Film Bibaha Bibhrat was released in the year 1969 Directed by Ashim Banerjee, starring: Anup Kumar, Lily Chakraborty, Robi Ghosh, Ajoy Ganguly, Nripati Chatterjee, Renuka Roy.

page86.title: Bhanu Goyenda Jahar Assistant
page86.description: Dr. Chatterjee's daughter Nupur runs away from her home because she has certain preconceived apprehensions about her marriage. Dr. Chatterjee announces a award of ten thousand rupees as a prize money for giving her whereabouts.

page86.title: Bipasha
page86.description: A son's frantic search for his mother. A wife's desperate search to get back her husband. A father's endless repentance for his mis-deeds. A revolt against society's empty rituals & rules. This is all what Bipasha comprises.

page86.title: Basanta Bilap
page86.description: This film mainly consist of clashes between four boys and some girls of the hostel namely 'Basanta Bilap'.

page86.title: Chattogram Astragar Lunthan/42
page86.description: A Patriotic Bengali movie, directed by Hemen Gupta, starring Anil Ganguly, Manju Dey, Bikash Ray, Pradip Kumar along with others. This movie is also known as Biyallish: 42 (1951) Or 42.

page86.title: Byatikrami
page86.description: Anuradha develops schizophrenic disorders after she loses her baby in the post-natal period. Her husband leaves her, and her affections are diverted towards her sister's husband.

page87.title: Box No 1313
page87.description: Box No. 1313 is marriage advertisement published in a local newspaper by Sushin Mukul Chatterjee and his spouse Madhu Chatterjee for their only son Joydip Chatterjee.

page87.title: Chaar
page87.description: Chaar film contains four short stories by different writers: Bateswarer Abodan by Parasuram, Porikkha by Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay, Kagtarua by Satyajit Ray and Dui Bondhu by Satyajit Ray.

page87.title: Bhooter Bhabishyat
page87.description: A rib-tickling comedy about a group of spirits who, in their various idiosyncrasies, try and save their only haunt, their resting place, when some unscrupulous builders try and break it down to build a modern monstrosity.

page87.title: Bye Bye Bangkok
page87.description: The film revolves around the life of four couples.Sadly enough, everyone is so busy pursuing their dreams that they throw caution to the winds and engage in alleged extra-marital affairs only to find themselves trapped in embarrassingly amusing situations.

page87.title: Chander Bari Bangla
page87.description: The film centers on a middle class joint family. The film is based on a Bengali story written by Pracheta Gupta

page87.title: Bibar
page87.description: Based on a raging controversial novel of the 80's CALCUTTA UNABASHED (Bibar) deals with the angst of city youth in calcutta, who are caught between the lures of a new,liberalized society and fast - fading traditional values.

page88.title: Chaplin
page88.description: The story of Chaplin revolves around Bangshi who is a great fan of Charlie Chaplin and earns his living by impersonating him, and who struggles to grant his son Nemoa's wish to have a birthday partiy like other kids that his daddy can hardly afford.

page88.title: Calcutta 71
page88.description: Calcutta 71 is a 1972 Bengali film directed by noted Indian art film director Mrinal Sen. This film is considered to be the second film of Mrinal Sen's Calcutta trilogy, the others being Interview, and Padatik.

page88.title: Bombaiyer Bombatay
page88.description: A book named Bombaiyer Bombete is made into a movie. Thus Feluda(fictional detective)  goes to Mumbai. Soon a murder takes place in Mumbai. Can Feluda solve the mystery of the mysterious person named Sanyal and a dangerous smuggling gang?

page88.title: Bari Theke Paliye
page88.description: Bari Theke Paliye is a 1958 Bengali film by director Ritwik Ghatak. It stars Parambhattarak Lahiri, Kali Bannerjee, Nripati Chatterjee, Padma Devi, and Gyanesh Mukherjee.

page88.title: Banshiwala
page88.description: Mridul, a young man comes back to his ancestral home, from abroad after 10 long years.The last 10 years had been very unfortunate for him as he could barely make two ends meet in London, as he never could procure a permanent job.

page88.title: Ajantrik
page88.description: Ajantrik is a 1958 Indian Bengali film written and directed by parallel filmmaker Ritwik Ghatak. The film is adapted from a Bengali short story of the same name written by Subodh Ghosh

page89.title: Autograph (2010)
page89.description: The plot revolves around three lives - a superstar, a young director and a theatre actress - and how their coming together during the process of making a film, changes them forever

page89.title: Bancharamer Bagan
page89.description: Set in the 1950s-80s, Bancharamer Bagan is a simple story and a satirical comedy about a farmer Bancharam who undergoes a moral fight with the village zamindar to retain the ownership of his piece of land.

page89.title: Baksho Rahashya
page89.description: Baksho Rahashya is a Bengali thriller Telefilm directed by Sandip Ray based on the story of the same name by Satyajit Ray.

page89.title: Badhu
page89.description: Chandan is jealous of Aparajita’s popularity in college and seeks revenge by kidnapping her. When things get out of hand, he is forced to marry her. After the wedding, Aparajita learns how dysfunctional Chandan’s family is, and decides to set things right.

page89.title: Badshahi Angti
page89.description: Based on the novel of the same name by Satyajit Ray.Feluda's holiday at Dhirukaka's residence in Lucknow with cousin Topshe is interrupted when neighbor Dr. Srivastava's badshahi angti (The Emperor's Ring) goes missing.

page89.title: 100% Love
page89.description: A remake of the 2007 Telugu film Aadavari Matalaku Ardhale Verule.When he finds her, her life changes. But she doesn't accept him. What will he do?

page90.title: Nayak
page90.description: While riding in a train on his way to collect an award, movie star Arindam (Uttam Kumar) encounters reporter Aditi (Sharmila Tagore) and begins pouring his heart out to her, almost against his will.

page90.title: Meghe Dhaka Tara 1960
page90.description: A selfless young woman (Supriya Choudhury) sacrifices her own happiness for her unappreciative family.

page90.title: Na Hannyate
page90.description: A tale of a woman, Jui, who is caught in a situation where she could save only one of her kids and leave the other to die. Being a mother, Jui could never forgive herself for having to choose between her two children — Ratan and Shiuli.

page90.title: Mriter Martye Agaman
page90.description: Mriter Martye Agaman is a Comedy, Drama, Romance bengali movie, directed by Pashupati Chattopadhyay, starring Chhabi Biswas, Bhanu Bandyopadhyay, Jahar Gangopadhyay, Jahar Roy along with others.

page90.title: Mouchak
page90.description: A newly appointed good-looking officer catches the eyes of the fathers of would-be-brides. But he has some other plans.

page90.title: Mishawr Rawhoshyo
page90.description: Mishawr Rohoshyo, a thriller, is The Egyptian Mystery to be solved by detective Raja Roy Chowdhury to unearth an Egyptian fortune. The all's not well quest takes Kakababu and Santu into a bumpy ride which finally ends at the baffling Egyptian tombs.

page91.title: Muktodhara
page91.description: This is a story about the prisoners of a correctional home ‒ Presidency jail who all have a dark past life but here they are being reformed day by day.

page91.title: Mukti
page91.description: The story tells of an artist, Prasanta presented in the stereotypically romantic image: dedicated to his vocation, paying no heed to his scandalous reputation and with a cavalier attitude to his conservative father-in-law's demands.

page91.title: Necklace
page91.description: Biswanath, a chartered accountant by profession, on the day he gets a promotion in his office, buys a gorgeous necklace to gift it to his beautiful wife Shikha. He also plans a party to celebrate his promotion.

page91.title: Memories In March
page91.description: A bereaved mother, dumbstruck by the news of an accidental death of her 28-year-old son, comes to Kolkata to carry out the last rituals, pack and carry his belongings back to Delhi.

page91.title: Meghe Dhaka Tara (2013)
page91.description: The film is inspired by the life and works of Bengali film director Ritwik Ghatak. The film also depicts the socio-political environment of contemporary West Bengal during the Tebhaga and Naxalite movements.

page91.title: Namte Namte
page91.description: Ananda is a very meek guy and is scared of confronting people. He is a peace-loving man and very shy in nature. He works as a clerk in a government office. His wife Seema is, however, a spirited woman and remains tense about him and her family.

page92.title: Moyna
page92.description: Raj Narayan was a zamindar. He loved two things - playing with the lathi and spending nights with women. On the occasion of his daughter's rice ceremony his mentor came to his house.

page92.title: Black (Bengali)
page92.description: The film revolves around a man named, Biltu, who takes vengeance to those who framed his father (a police officer) with false charges and as a result, the latter commits suicide to get rid of this humiliation.

page92.title: Byomkesh Phire Elo
page92.description: This is the third installment of Byomkesh series By Anjan Dutt, serving as a sequel to Byomkesh Bakshi and Abar Byomkesh.Byomkesh is asked to help the police solve the mysterious murder of a wealthy old man.

page92.title: Atanka
page92.description: An upright teacher is a witness to a murder committed by one of his ex-students. The local goons start terrorizing the teacher. The film highlights the dubiousness of the political class and how they misuse the local youths and the police.

page92.title: Asukh
page92.description: The film is about the schism between a film star daughter, Rohini (Debashree Roy) and her father Sudhamoy (Soumitra Chatterjee), who is unwilling but forced to depend on his daughter's earnings.

page92.title: Ashite Ashiona
page92.description: The story is a dream sequence dreamt by an old man, Sadananda. He was so inclined to get back to his youthful state that he dreamed of a magical pond where one could regain one’s youth.  A classic comedy!!

page93.title: Aranyer Din Ratri
page93.description: A group of Calcutta city slickers, including the well-off Asim, the meek Sanjoy and the brutish Hari, head out for a weekend in the wilderness. Before long, however, the friends find themselves neglecting nature.

page93.title: Aradhana (Bengali dubbed)
page93.description: Dashing pilot Arun romances Vandana Tripathi, and both in love with each other, become very intimate, and as a result Vandana gets pregnant.(Bengali Dubbed Version)

page93.title: Apur Sansar
page93.description: This final installment in Satyajit Ray's Apu Trilogy follows Apu's life as an orphaned adult aspiring to be a writer.The film is based on the last two-thirds of the 1932 Bengali novel, Aparajito, by Bibhutibhushan Bandopadhyay.

page93.title: Apur Panchali
page93.description: The film follows the journey of Subir Banerjee the child actor who portrayed "Apu" of Satyajit Ray's masterpiece Pather Panchali. The events take place in two time periods. While the present day events are shot in color the past events are in black and white.

page93.title: Aparajito
page93.description: The second part of Satyajit Ray's famous Apu trilogy, this Indian drama focuses on young Apu, who lives with his mother, Sarbajaya (Karuna Bannerjee), and father, Harihar (Kanu Bandyopadhyay), near the Ganges River.

page93.title: Antony Firingee
page93.description: Antony Firingee is a 1967 Indian Bengali-language biographical musical drama film directed by Sunil Bannerjee, starring Uttam Kumar and Tanuja. It is a biopic based on the life of Anthony Firingee, a Bengali language folk poet of Portuguese origin.

page94.title: Antarjali Jatra
page94.description: A father encourages his daughter to marry a dying man in order to inherit his wealth.

page94.title: Ajab Ganyer Ajab Katha
page94.description: Ajab Ganyer Ajab Katha is a Drama bengali movie, directed by Tapan Sinha, starring Soumitra Chatterjee, Debashree Roy, Nirmal Kumar, Manoj Mitra along with others

page94.title: Agni Pariksha
page94.description: Agni Pariksha is a 1954 Indian Bengali romantic drama film directed by Agradoot and starring Uttam Kumar and Suchitra Sen. The film was adapted from novel of same name.

page94.title: Agantuk
page94.description: Satyajit Ray's final film is a deceptively simple modern fable about a mysterious and world-weary old man (Utpal Dutt), who comes to stay with a middle-class Calcutta family, claiming to be the wife's long-lost uncle, Manmohan Mitra.

page94.title: Abosheshey
page94.description: After his parents' divorce, Soumyo lives with his father in San Francisco. But he returns to Kolkata after 22 years when his mother, Suchismita, dies. He then begins a journey of self-discovery as he explores the city.

page94.title: Abohoman
page94.description: Marital strife follows when an aging filmmaker meets an actress who bears an uncanny resemblance to his wife in her younger days

page95.title: Abhijan
page95.description: A taxi driver attempts to introduce his cab service in rural Bengal against many odds.A 1962 Bengali film directed by the Indian filmmaker Satyajit Ray.

page95.title: Byomkesh Bakshi
page95.description: A murder went wrong, leaving four suspects on the way in the eastern coalfield region of India.Plagued with a series of unexplained troubles that broke out suddenly, owner of a coal mine seeks the help of Byomkesh Bakshi to sort things out for him.

page95.title: Har Har Byomkesh
page95.description: Famed detective Byomkesh Bakshi investigates the murder of a man who had just thrown a party to celebrate his recovery from a long illness.

page95.title: Amanush 2
page95.description: A man struggles to stay on the straight and narrow after a troubled childhood and a stint in juvenile detention.

page95.title: Rajkahini
page95.description: This film revolves around the era of 1947 and explores the consequences of partition of India. Delving into the grim history of the partition, Mukherjee's movie Rajkahini is weaved around a border between the two nations that runs through a brothel housing eleven women.

page95.title: Kalkijug
page95.description: The film delineates a striking clash of ego between two brilliant minds that pans out dramatically when an old unsolved murder mystery resurfaces out of the blue.

page96.title: Nirbaak
page96.description: Nirbaak is a medley of four tales of silent love, involving one woman (Sushmita), three men (Anjan, Jishu and Ritwick), a tree and a dog. The stories are intertwined and connected through Sushmita Sen`s character.

page96.title: Rater Rajanigandha
page96.description: Jui ) is a hardened prostitute with a bleak past. Her parents had perished in a political riot and a trusted neighbor Natabar (Kharaj Mukherjee) accompanied her to Kolkata where she eventually took up the job of a bar singer before joining the flesh trade.

page96.title: Manihara
page96.description: Former CBI officer and private investigator Rudrajit Roy is roped in by industrialist Arun Chowdhury to probe the mysterious disappearance of his wife Monideepa. His investigation reveals an eerie tale of frustration and betrayal.

page96.title: Hirer Angti
page96.description: Gandharva Kumar reveals a long-forgotten secret wherein he claims to be heir to the family property to Ratanlal Babu.

page96.title: Chinna Patra
page96.description: An award winning old classic movie, directed by Yatrik, starring Uttam Kumar in a double role. One is the unruly, rich and spoilt brat who is killed by his enemies, while the other, a good guy, reaches the dead man's house and is compelled to take his place.

page96.title: Agnishwar
page96.description: A 1975 Bengali film about the life and career of a patriotic, idealistic doctor. It was written by Balai Chand Mukhopadhyay (from his novel Agni), directed by Arabinda Mukhopadhyay, and starred Uttam Kumar, Madhabi Mukherjee.

page97.title: Gaj Ukiler Hatya Rahasya
page97.description: Gajapati and Gupi are best of friends and play chess every day.Gaja is a lawyer and a miser. One day Gaja is discovered dead lying in his room with a ‘gamcha’ around his neck.

page97.title: Alo Amar Alo
page97.description: A Rich industrialist philanthropist and womanizer gets a poor girl kidnapped. In the melee the girl is hit and becomes amnesic.He falls in love but when she gets memory back?

page97.title: Abhaya O Srikanta
page97.description: Srikanta and Abhaya get introduced to each other on their way to Rangoon. A distant relative of Abhaya named Rohini Babu accompanies Abhaya. Srikanta lands in Rangoon and gets a job.

page97.title: Raag Anurag
page97.description: A 1975 Bengali drama movie starring Ranjit Mallick, Aparna Sen, Anup Kumar, Nripati Chattyopadhyay.

page97.title: Neelkantha
page97.description: A 1985 Bengali movie starring Prasenjit Chatterjee, Aparna Sen, Dilip Roy, Anup Kumar, Samit Bhanja, Mamata Shankar, Biplab Chatterjee, Mahua Roy Chowdhury.

page97.title: Shunyo E Buke
page97.description: Shunyo E Buke is a 2005 Bengali film directed by Kaushik Ganguly. The film deals with the psyche of men and women and their physical relationship.

page98.title: Hemlock Society
page98.description: Hemlock Society is a school that teaches aspirants to commit suicide. One of its students, Meghna has a near-death experience, changing the lives of others.

page98.title: Chhutii Aar Picnic
page98.description: Adapted from Rabindranath Tagore`s famous romantic novella, Shesher Kobita, Chhutii Aar Picnic tells the timeless story of three people from different worlds who meet at a resort.

page98.title: Roudra Chaya
page98.description: Uttam Kumar plays a long-lost son of an industrialist who is brought up in a church and turns into a goon. This film has Anjana Bhowmik, Chhaya Debi, Kamal Mitra, Tarun Kumar and Subrata.

page98.title: Le Chakka
page98.description: The film is a remake of the Tamil movie Chennai 600028.A love story between an outsider boy of an area and snatch an area from politicians by playing cricket.

page98.title: Antaheen
page98.description: Abhik (Rahul Bose) loses faith in the people around and develops an online relationship with Brinda (Radhika Apte), a young woman who works as a journalist.

page98.title: Kadambari
page98.description: A biopic on Kadambari Debi who was Rabindranath Tagore's sister-in-law - his elder brother Jyotirindranath Tagore's wife. Tagore shared a good bond with his sister-in-law.

page99.title: Villain
page99.description: Arnab, an honest and upright PWD road inspector.Things take a turn after authorities frame corruption charges against him and send him to jail.

page99.title: 8:08 ER Bonga Local
page99.description: Ananta Das a common man lives in Bangaon, West Bengal, commutes to Kolkata daily on the 8:08 Bongaon local train. Every day he witnesses many unethical, illegal and corrupt practices around him but refrains from raising his voice.

page99.title: Tabe Tai Hok
page99.description: The film moves between two worlds. One is a dark collage with vignettes of fantasy, the other a sunny happy real world. And three mortals are caught up in a web of deceit, love and overwhelming passion.

page99.title: Naxaal
page99.description: The backdrop of the film is an era that is known to every Bengali. An era, which is popularly known as NAXAL AMOL or the NAXAL PERIOD. It was a period in the history of the state of West Bengal.

page99.title: The Royal Bengal Tiger
page99.description: The film is a story of a common man who has to cope with everyday issues which leave his ego crushed and bruised. He has given up on life when he meets an uncommon friend who teaches him to live life without fear.

page99.title: Swapner Din
page99.description: The film is woven around the dreams of three different persons and their journeys in search of dreams.Paresh, the central character, travels by a government jeep with a 16mm film projector.

page100.title: Utsab
page100.description: Two middle-aged daughters of Bhagabati come together with their families in their old house to celebrate Durga Puja.

page100.title: Pather Sesh Kothay
page100.description: Abhimanyu is a mentally challenged young man who lives Kolkata, India. He became mentally challenged due to a car accident.His parents are concerned for Abhimanyu and wonder about the future of Abhimanyu after their death and his sister's marriage.

page100.title: Charulata
page100.description: The lonely wife of a newspaper editor falls in love with her visiting cousin-in-law, who shares her love for literature.

page100.title: Moubane Aaj
page100.description: The film is based in a village where Satish Roy a Zamindar is unhappy because of Mainak, his son never listens to him. He is also hell-bent on developing the potential of the village youngsters by getting them trained in football or in his wood-cutting factory.

page100.title: Mayabazaar
page100.description: This is an intricately crafted movie with three stories, Smriti (Memories), Satwa (Soul) and Bhobiswot (Future) .Mayabazaar is an unusual attempt to give us a different cinematic experience.

page100.title: Chha-e Chhuti
page100.description: A technician's accidental death leads to a workers' union's strike for a week. Few television and actresses with their director go to a trip to Mominpur to spend the week. There Kunal slaps a caretaker and he dies.

page101.title: Uro Chithi
page101.description: While battling the demons of recession, the protagonist deletes one text message after another from his phone. In the process of deletion, each of the SMSes leaves behind a short story that deals with lust, caution and many other emotions.

page101.title: Tasher Desh
page101.description: The story of a prince who escapes his destiny, the prison of his mind. He lands on a fascist island and incites women to revolt. A psychedelic fantasy about destiny and humanity, social control and Utopian revolution.

page101.title: Hoi Choi
page101.description: About the noise and fanfare, Hoichoi, of a young theater group fighting for a start in theater. It shows their concerns about love and friendships and the importance of each, as well as ambitions and ideologies.

page101.title: Shukno Lanka
page101.description: A Junior artist living in a tinsel town, who is yet to taste success after a struggle of 30 years of acting career, gets the shock of his life when a prolific filmmaker, offers him a lead role in his next film.

page101.title: Amodini
page101.description: Amodini is a rich landowner's daughter. Unable to face social stigma, her father arranges her marriage to a much older person, who fails to turn up on the wedding day. To save the situation, she is forced to marry a 15-year-old boy.

page101.title: Bolo Na Tumi Aamar
page101.description: A couple marries in order to save the bride from her father's choice of groom, but they don't actually love each other. It's "make it work" time.The film was inspired from Telugu film Happy.

page102.title: Shedin Dekha Hoyechilo
page102.description: A girl elopes with her boyfriend on her wedding day; her father finds the boy's friends and holds them captive to get the whereabouts of the couple. One boy, among the friends held captive, falls in love with the bride's sister.

page102.title: Parama
page102.description: The movie is about a 40-year-old married woman, Paroma whose well-settled, very normal and predictable life turns upside down when Rahul, an expatriate photo-journalist working for a magazine chooses her to pose for a photo essay.

page102.title: 3 Kanya
page102.description: The story of the film revolves around the lives of three women– Aparna, Damini, and Nancy. Aparna suspects that her husband is having an affair with Damini.But, a relationship between Aparna and Damini begins.

page102.title: Ogo Bodhu Shundori
page102.description: Ogo Bodhu Shundori is a 1981 Bengali comedy film, directed by Salil Dutta. It was one of the last films of the iconic Bengali actor Uttam Kumar, who died during production.

page102.title: Mahanagar
page102.description: Life at home changes when a house-wife from a middle-class, conservative family in Calcutta gets a job as a saleswoman.

page102.title: Kailashey Kelenkari
page102.description: The story revolves around the blatant smuggling and illegal trading in ancient sculptures across the country. Detective Feluda steps in to solve the crime and nab the culprits.

page103.title: Iti Mrinalini
page103.description: Mrinalini, an aging actress, writes a suicide note. As a performer, the first lesson she had learned was timing. On the stage of life, her entrance had been outside her control; but she wants to choose the moment of her exit at least.

page103.title: Andhar Periye
page103.description: An old classic film directed by Tapan Sinha. Cast includes Madhabi Mukherjee, Subhendu Chatterjee, Sumitra Mukherjee, Anil Chatterjee, Nirmal Kumar, Chinmoy Roy, Bikash Roy, Subrata Chatterjee, Kalyan Chatterjee, Premangsu Bose.

page103.title: Damu
page103.description: A gullible man faces strange situations on his quest fo find an elephant in order to keep a promise he made with a little girl.

page103.title: The Bong Connection
page103.description: The film is based on the lives of Bengali's across the world, especially on those settled abroad

page103.title: Uttoran
page103.description: Sen Gupta, a doctor who only treats upper-class patients, is forced to confront his own moral and medical beliefs as he discovers rural India during an unexpected stop at a village.

page103.title: Antareen
page103.description: A young writer, seeking inspiration, is living alone in a friend's old mansion in Calcutta. One night he starts talking to an anonymous stranger over the phone. The conversation soon develops into a relationship as details of their lives are revealed.
